title: lera_(sighttobehold)
body:
Lera (also known as "Lerochka") is a Russian political/war opposition mascot, usually depicted featuring the "white-blue-white flag":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White-blue-white_flag], peace sign, white ribbon and Navalny ! political sign.

Created by [[SightToBehold]] in 2022 to represent the Russian liberal opposition to the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]]. Her name is supposedly derived from "Valeriya Novodvorskaya":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valeriya_Novodvorskaya], a well-known Russian political opposition figure.

h4. External links

* "Creator's Pixiv":https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/23756877
* "Marichka Wiki (English)":https://marichka.fandom.com/wiki/Lerochka
* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/%D0%9B%D1%94%D1%80%D0%BE%D1%87%D0%BA%D0%B

title: melody_(projektmelody)
body:
A Canadian [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], starting out as a "Virtual Porntuber" (i.e. a VTuber who specialized on pornographic content) on Chaturbate, becoming popular yet somewhat controversial after becoming the no.1 Chaturbate channel in February 2020. From March 9th on, Melody also began streaming on Twitch.

In November 2020, she became one of the founding members of the Western VTuber talent agency [[VShojo]], after having been her active management for some months prior.

Per her lore, she is a futuristic AI program with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[purple hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[blue eyes]].

title: flying_tigers
body:
The [b]American Volunteer Group[/b], better known as the "Flying Tigers", were three squadrons of American [[pilot]]s formed in 1941 to fly [[P-40 Warhawk]] fighters in the colors of the [[kuomintang|Republic of China]] against Japanese warplanes. Though the group was formed before America's official entry into [[World War II]] and intended to operate as mercenaries for the Chinese government outside of American authority, several delays meant that the AVG first flew in combat after the attack on [[Pearl Harbor]]. The fighter group gained legendary fame for providing positive headlines during a period when most news was bleak.

The AVG was disbanded just six months later, replaced by an official U.S. fighter group in the theater, though the new unit kept the "Flying Tigers" livery on many of their airplanes.

title: trilby
body:
A hat that is often erroneously referred to as a [[fedora]], which has a wider brim. 

The main way to distinguish a Trilby hat is by its [b]shorter brims[/b], in fact, so short that they don't give sun protection for the eyes and their purpose is just for fashion. Trilby hats [i]tend[/i] to have its back trim turned up. In media, however, artists usually won't draw a trilby with it's trims turned up or down.

Do not confuse with [[bowler hat]], which have a rounded crown.

h4. Examples

* !asset #25322438
* !post #3241231: Trilby with back brim turned up and front brim turned down
* !post #7253168: Trilby with flat brims

h4. Non examples

* !post #9037250: [[Fedora]], brims are long enough to give sun protection.
* !post #6460763: [[Porkpie hat]]s are similar to trilby, but they have a short flat crown.
* !post #8441492: [[Bowler hat]]s have short brims but a rounded crown.

h4. See also

* [[Hat]]
* [[Fedora]]
* [[Bowler hat]]

title: yunyun_(konosuba)
body:
[b]Yunyun[/b] is a main supporting character of the [[kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_shukufuku_wo!|KonoSuba]] series and deuteragonist of the [[Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo!]] spin-off. She is a member of the Crimson Demons and daughter of the Village Chief, as well as former classmate and self-proclaimed rival to [[Megumin]].

Yunyun is a young girl with [[red eyes|crimson-colored eyes]], [[large breasts]], a determined and timid look, and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] ([[brown hair|dark brown]] in anime) with a [[crown braid]] and tied in two [[low_twintails|low twin tails]] with [[red bow|red bows]] that lie on her shoulders. She is a little taller than Megumin, with more balanced proportions.

Yunyun usually wears a [[black cape|black]] [[hooded cape]], similar in design to Megumin's. She wields a silver [[wand]] and wears a [[dagger]] on her hip. Underneath the cape, she wears a low-cut black [[blouse]] with a [[short necktie|short]] [[pink necktie|pink necktie]], and an ultra-short, [[pink skirt|pink]] [[miniskirt]] as well as a pair of dark toned [[pink thighhighs|pink stockings]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. [spoilers]She wears a revealing outfit not because of personal preference, but because [[Dust (konosuba)|Dust]] tricked her into thinking it is a good way to make friends.[/spoilers]

Although never shown visually, she has a barcode on her inner thigh.

title: langley_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], her callsign is likely a nod to Langley of Fairfax county, Virginia, the real world location of US Central Intelligence Agency HQ. Voiced by [[Kobayashi Yuu]].

Langley the Silver Spider, an S rank Sinner and an agent in service to the 9th Agency of DisCity. Her alignment is Treachery.

Langley has a noir detective style appearance, she has [[medium hair|medium]] length [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]], wears [[black eyeshadow]], [[eyeliner]] and [[black lips|black lipstick]] make up, and has a silver [[spider tattoo]] on her left [[facial tattoo|temple]]. Wears a [[single earring|single]] [[floating earring|dangle earring]] on her left ear and a [[mole on neck|mole]] on the left side of her neck. Typically seen wearing a [[white headwear|white]]/[[grey headwear|grey]] [[fedora]] or [[trilby]] with a [[hat feather]].

She wears a [[brown shirt|brown]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[pink necktie|pink]] [[striped necktie]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pencil skirt]], and a [[grey jacket]] [[jacket on shoulders|on her shoulders]]. Wears a pair of [[black gloves|black]]/[[leather gloves|leather]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]]/[[leather boots|leather]] [[thigh boots]]. Usually seen with a long barrelled [[handgun]] and a walking [[cane]].

h4. Appearance

title: gundam_aerial_slap_(meme)
body:
Parody of a scene from [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]] involving the [[blood on hands|bloody hand]] of [[Gundam Aerial Rebuild]] [spoiler]after it crushed the terrorist's body into a bloody mess to save [[Miorine Rembran]], though this also traumatized her in the process[/spoiler].

Also known as "Fresh tomato flavor" (フレッシュトマト味) in Japan due to "a flavor":[https://japanese-snacks-republic.com/product/product_page_15850.html] of [[Aerial (food)|]] snack food that was collaborated with the anime [spoiler]and a scene earlier in the series showing [[Suletta Mercury]]'s hand covered in [[tomato]] juice during the festival, foreshadowing this scene[/spoiler].

h4. See also

* [[Bright slap]]
other_names: なんで...笑ってるの?人殺し!

title: tears
body:
The fluid produced by the eyes, oftentimes (though not always) when [[crying]] or [[laughing]].

If an image has a comical depiction of tears, it should use the [[teardrop]] tag instead of [[tears]].

For tears in clothing, see [[tearing clothes]], [[torn clothes]] and related tags. For the visual effect in which "tears" appear across an image, see [[page tear]].

h4. Types of tears
* [[Blood from eyes]]
* [[Colored tears]]
** [[Black tears]]

* [[Floating tears]]
* [[Glowing tears]]
* [[Happy tears]]

title: ai-generated
body:
h5. Uploading fully AI-generated art to Danbooru is against the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]]; see forum #223144.

An image or video that, rather than being fully drawn or fully animated by a human artist, was fully generated by an artificial intelligence program/model.

This tag applies to [b]fully AI-generated images[/b] or [b]fully AI-generated interpolated animation[/b]. That is, images or videos that underwent no edits or extremely minor retouchings. For edited images and videos, see [[AI-assisted]].

Note that AI-assisted posts that are up to Danbooru's standards are exempt from the ban on AI-generated art.

h4. Examples of AI model outputs
h5. Images
* !post #7404815: [[Stable Diffusion]] (2022)
* !post #6387617: [[Stable Diffusion]] (2022)
* !post #5851580: [[nai_diffusion|NovelAIv1]] (2022)
* !post #7402576: [[Midjourney]] (2023)
* !post #7173141: [[Midjourney|nijijourney]] (2023)
* !post #7634318: [[dall-e|DALL·E 3]] (2023)
* !post #7096638: [[nai_diffusion|NovelAIv3]] (2023)
* !post #8865710: [[Stable Diffusion|NoobAI-XL]] (2024)
* !asset #24887514: [[nai_diffusion|NovelAIv4]] (2025)
* !asset #25339296: [[GPT4o|GPT4o]] (2025)

h5. Video
* !post #8945894: "PixVerse":[https://app.pixverse.ai] (2025)

h4. Identification

Signs that something may be AI-generated:

* Anything in {{width:512 height:768|512×768}} or {{width:768 height:512|768×512}} resolution. This is a very common resolution for Stable Diffusion 1.5-based models, and it is rarely used by humans.
** Anything in {{width:832 height:1216|832×1216}} or {{width:1216 height:832|1216×832}} resolution. This is a very common resolution for Stable Diffusion XL-based models.
* High quality art in low resolution, less than 1000×1000. Older AI generators are restricted to low resolutions, whereas skilled artists normally use much higher resolutions. AI art may be [[upscaled]] to higher resolution, but this can produce artifacts. 
** Newer models are capable of higher resolution, such as NovelAI starting at a free tier of 1024×1024.
* EXIF metadata in the file indicating it is AI-generated. For example, AI prompts or model names. On the upload page, you can click the filesize beneath the image to see the EXIF metadata. Danbooru will automatically tag [[AI-generated]] after upload if the metadata indicates it is AI-generated.
* Abnormal/unusual mistakes within the artwork, such as:
** [[Anatomical nonsense]], such as extra legs (post #5732513), fused fingers (post #5742855), fused legs (post #5735212), etc.
** Strangely drawn objects/environments such as a book with it's cover as another layer of pages (post #5738243), wooden floor conforming with the shape of a character's hair (post #5850417), poor line continuity/object permanence when an object is hidden or goes behind other objects (post #5779922), etc.
** Note that [[bad hands]] or other mistakes are not in themselves signs of AI-generation, as humans can make mistakes too. The errors made by AI tend to be completely illogical or physically impossible things that no human would draw.
* A brand new artist pumping out improbably large volumes of high quality-looking art in a short period of time. This isn't automatically a sign of AI-generation, as sometimes new artists may release a pre-prepared portfolio of artwork to establish their presence.
* An artist with an illogically drastic change in art style after early-October 2022 (around the time NovelAI became popular). This can easily be seen with artists with a low quality art style suddenly shifting into the generic-looking artstyle typical of NovelAI. Bear in mind that artstyles of skilled artists can evolve and improve over time. Some other notable dates for this would be:
*** 2023/11/15 - NovelAI V3 release
*** 2024/10/18 - NoobAI-XL release
*** 2025/02/28 - NovelAI V4 release
*** 2025/03/26 - GPT4o native image generation release
* No [[signature]], [[watermark]], or [[web address]]. Human artists often (but not always) sign their work, while AI works are often unsigned, as older AI models can't produce legible text, let alone realistic signatures. Do note however, that some AI artists may add a signature or watermark after the image is generated.
* Mentions of "AI" or common AI generators such as "Nijijourney," "Midjourney," "NovelAI," or "Stable Diffusion" in the tags or description of a post are a good place to start, but should not be used to automatically assume [[AI-generated|AI-generation]] (see below).
** [b]Note:[/b] Artists frequently use AI keywords when prohibiting their work for its use, so be careful when making assumptions based on them.
 

If you are unsure whether a post is AI-generated or not, ask in topic #22285.

h4. Common AI models
* [[DALL-E]]
* [[Midjourney]] (Nijijourney, etc.)
* [[Stable Diffusion]]
** "Pony Diffusion":[https://civitai.com/models/257749]
** "Illustrious":[https://civitai.com/models/795765]
*** "NoobAI-XL":[https://civitai.com/models/833294]
* [[nai diffusion|NovelAI Diffusion]]
[tn](This is not an exhaustive list by any means, but for Danbooru's purposes, almost all generated images posted here originate from or are derivatives of these models.)[/tn]

h4. See also

* [[AI-Generated art (topic)]]
* [[AI-Generated background]]
* [[AI Angry Dr. Mario (Meme)]]
* [[AI Drawing Anime Characters Eating Ramen (Meme)]]
* [[AI Drawing Person in Cake (Meme)]]
* [[Gaming Penis Ikebana (Meme)]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]
h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Artificial intelligence art":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence_art]
* "Wikipedia: AI slop":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AI_slop]
* "NovelAI":[https://novelai.net/]
* "Civitai":[https://civitai.com/]
* "AIBooru":[https://aibooru.online/]

title: beanstalk_(arknights)
body:
[i]Top specialist Metal Crab breeder Beanstalk, commanding her Metal Crab teams to guard the frontline.[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 10[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td][[hyena girl|Reproba]][/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]155 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A professional [[domesticated metal crab (arknights)|]] breeder born into a family of Columbian farmers. She sought employment in Rhodes Island after unfruitful proposals with various businesses. Since then, she successfully passed screening and now provides assistance in logistics and reconnaissance. 

Her pet crabs lend their assistance while fighting on the high ground with her weapon of choice, a scoped crossbow. All of the crabs have their own names. The one she carries in a box is called [[Peacake (arknights)|]].

Her motif is based on the [[aardwolf]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Itou Ayasa]] (Japanese), Niunai-kun (Chinese), and Jang Ye-na (Korean). Her art designer is [[Kang Yiqian (self cultivation)|]].

h4. Skins
* !post #4287604: Default
* !post #4287605: [[Beanstalk (Elite II) (Arknights)|Elite II]]
* [[Beanstalk (Gift Uncompleted) (Arknights)|Gift Uncompleted]]

title: pyra_(xenoblade)
body:
[[Rex (xenoblade)|Rex]]'s Blade in [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]]. Known as [b]Homura[/b] in Japanese. She is one of the personalities of the Aegis, along with [[Mythra (xenoblade)|]]. Unlike Mythra, she has a sweet and amiable personality.

She has [[red hair]] in a [[short hair|short]] [[bob cut]] with [[swept bangs]], [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[chest jewel]]. She wears an unusual outfit with [[red shorts|red]] [[short shorts]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[tiara]], [[earrings]], and [[red thighhighs]]. 

She wields a [[sword]] called the [[Aegis Sword (xenoblade)|]].

* [[Pyra (Pro Swimmer) (Xenoblade)|Pro Swimmer]]

title: bokujou_monogatari
body:
A multi-system farming simulation video game series. The player moves onto an abandoned or inherited farm and must rejuvenate their new hometown.

Most well-known in the West as [i]Harvest Moon[/i] (1997-2013), when it was distributed by Natsume. In 2014, Natsume lost the license to the series, and as the rights to the [[Harvest Moon (natsume)|]] name in the West is owned by them, the series renamed itself to [i]Story of Seasons[/i] outside of Japan.

The video game series [i][[Rune Factory]][/i] is a spin-off of the Bokujou Monogatari series; taking the game elements of Bokujou Monogatari and combining them with fantasy RPG game elements. Since 2019, the series also collaborated with [[Doraemon]] franchise and released two [i]Doraemon's Story of Seasons[/i] spin-off series.

title: big_smoke
body:
Melvin Harris, or more infamously known as [b]Big Smoke[/b], is one of the main character [spoilers]and secondary antagonist[/spoilers] in [[Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas]].

He is [[fat]], but says big boned to himself, and wears a black [[bowler hat]] along with a green shirt to represent Grove Street.

Beyond the game, he's known for several famous scenes which later became a [[meme]]:
* Him almost assaulting Carl Johnson: "You picked the wrong house, fool!"
* [[big smoke's order (meme)|His big order of food]] during the mission "Drive Thru".
* The infamous line "All we had to do is follow the damn train, CJ!" when failing the mission "Wrong Side of the Tracks".

title: enkidu_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is a member of [b]Amnesia[/b] who was hired by [[Hilda (Under Night In-Birth)|Hilda]] and seeks out strong In-Births throughout the Hollow Night. He crosses paths with the likes of [[Waldstein (under night in-birth)|]] and [[Gordeau (under night in-birth)|]], both of whom he considers worthy opponents. His real name is [i]Gaien Enkidou[/i] ([b]円鬼堂凱庵[/b]).

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Takeuchi Shunsuke]]


h4. External links

* "Enkidu Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Enkidu

title: carmine_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is an unallied [b]In-Birth[/b] who fights just for his own enjoyment. His EXS ability allows him to manipulate and weaponize his own blood. His violent tendencies quickly earned him a reputation on the streets of Kanzakai as [i][b]Carmine-Prime[/b][/i]. He is motivated by making others feel pain and revels in suffering of others. He attends the same school as [[Kido hyde|Hyde]]. Hyde and Carmine often trade insults with each other, such as Hyde calling him [i]"Crawfish"[/i], and Carmine calling him [i]"Clownfish"[/i].

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] Kondou Takashi [b]EN:[/b] Greg Chun


h4. External links

* "Carmine Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Carmine

title: mococo_abyssgard_(new_year)
body:
The 2nd/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Mococo Abyssgard]], as seen on as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/rswxx/status/1743493431048233078]. 

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[spiked choker]] with a [[neck tassel]], a [[short kimono|short]] [[fur-trimmed kimono|fur-trimmed]] [[multicolored kimono|multicolored]] [[white kimono|white]] [[pink kimono|pink]] and [[black kimono|black]] [[floral print kimono|floral]] [[floral print|print]] [[print kimono|print]] with [[uneven sleeves]] (a long [[cross-laced sleeves|cross-laced sleeve]] reaching [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]] on her left arm and a [[single bare shoulder]]), a [[pink shawl]], a [[pink sash|pink]] [[obi]] with a [[pink belt]] instead of an obijime, [[thigh strap]]s on both her legs, and [[black boots|black]] [[paw shoes|paw]] [[boots]] with pink highlights. She also has optional [[paw gloves]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[short hair|short]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[sidelocks]], decorated with a [[hair flower]], a [[kanzashi]], a [[pom pom hair ornament]] and a [[kouhaku nawa]] [[hair bow]].

* !post #7068770: Merchandise

title: omaru_polka_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Omaru Polka]].

It consists of a [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[jester cap]], [[x hair ornament|x-shaped]] [[hairclip]]s each one with a different card suit ornament at the end, a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[halter shirt]] with playing suit-themed [[bow button|bow]] [[buttons]] and a [[navel cutout]], a [[detached collar|detached]] [[wing collar]] with a [[red bowtie|red]] [[traditional bowtie]], a puffed [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical-stripped]] [[blue skirt|blue]] and white [[layered skirt|layered]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[bow skirt|bow]] [[back bow|on the back]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] and [[uneven legwear|asymmetrical]] [[vertical-striped thighhighs|vertical striped]] [[cross-laced legwear|cross-laced]] [[blue thighhighs|blue]] and [[pink thighhighs]] and [[mismatched footwear|mismatched]] [[red shoes|red]] [[pointy shoes]]. She also wears a [[single glove|single]] [[single elbow glove|elbow glove]] [[cross-laced gloves|cross-laced]] [[multicolored gloves|multi-colored]] [[black gloves|black]] and [[red gloves|red]] elbow glove in one arm and an [[arm strap]] and a [[wrist cuffs|wrist cuff]] in the other.

h4. Appearance

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] with this outfit are [[bangs pinned back]] into a [[topknot]] with [[multiple hairpins|multiple]] [[hairpin]]s and [[multiple hair bows]].

This costume consists of an [[ear ribbon]], a [[brown hat|brown]] [[fox hat|fox]] [[hat]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with [[short sleeves|short]] [[see-through sleeves]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[brown jacket]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[two-tone skirt|two-tone]] [[green skirt|green]] and [[white skirt|white]] [[high-waist skirt]], [[ankle strap]]s and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[mary janes]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] with this costume:

title: omaru_polka_(school_uniform)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Omaru Polka]].

This costume is a [[kogal]] [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], a [[multicolored bowtie|multicolored]] [[red bowtie|red]] and [[black bowtie|black]] [[diagonal-striped bowtie|diagonal-striped]] [[bowtie]], a [[brown cardigan]] either [[cardigan around waist|tied around her waist]] or worn under a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], a [[red skirt|red]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white socks|white]] [[loose socks]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]]. She has [[multicolored nails|multiple colored]] [[nail polish]] with [[nail art]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[very long hair]] in a [[side ponytail]] with multiple [[hairclip]] [[decora]] and [[multiple hair bows]]. Unlike her default costume, she has [[pink hair|pink]], [[black hair|black]], and [[blue hair]] [[streaked hair|streaks]].

h4. Appearance

title: omaru_polka_(6th_costume)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Omaru Polka]].

It's a [[waitress]] costume consisting of a [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[peaked cap]], a [[white shirt]] with [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[vertical-striped sleeves|vertical-striped]] [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[brown vest]] with a [[name tag]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[layered skirt]] [[frilled overskirt|frilled]] [[red overskirt|red]] [[overskirt]], [[mismatched legwear]] consisting of a [[red thighhighs|red]] [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] with a [[red garter straps|red garter strap]] and a [[white socks|white sock]] [[socks over thighhighs|over it]] on one leg and a [[checkered thighhighs|checkered thighhigh]] on the other and [[red shoes|red]] [[mary janes]]. She also has an [[official alternate color|alternate]] [[black dress|black]] variant of this costume.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume is [[medium hair]] in 2 distinct hairstyles, both of them held by [[hair bow]]s matching the costume main color:

* Thick [[twintails]] (although they are sometimes depicted as fuzzy [[double bun]]s)
* A [[wide ponytail|wide]] [[high ponytail]]

title: omaru_polka_(5th_costume)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Omaru Polka]].

It consists of a [[black choker]] [[heart choker]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[red jacket]] [[plaid jacket|plaid]] [[cropped jacket]] [[open jacket|left open]], along with a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]] exposing her [[midriff]] and [[navel]], [[plaid shorts|plaid]] [[red shorts|red]] [[short shorts]] with a [[brown belt]] and [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]]. She also has [[red nails|red]] [[nail polish]] and wears multiple [[multiple necklaces]], [[multiple bracelets|multiple]] [[bracelet]]s, and [[hoop earrings]] and optional [[red-tinted eyewear|red-tinted]] [[opaque glasses|opaque]] [[heart-shaped eyewear|heart-shaped]] [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on head|on her head]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[long hair]] [[blonde hair]] with [[black hair|black]], [[blue hair|blue]], and [[pink hair]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[swept bangs|swept]] [[blunt bangs]], she also now has a regular ahoge instead of her signature propeller ahoge.

title: sonic_channel
body:
The official Japanese-language website and online hub for the [i][[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]][/i] series, managed by [[Sega]] of Japan. Launched on November 21, 2003, it serves as an all-in-one resource for Sonic news, artwork, and fan engagement, with content often shared exclusively in Japanese before being referenced elsewhere.

[i]Sonic Channel[/i] regularly posts high-resolution illustrations and character art—sometimes featuring special events or anniversaries, as well as monthly calendar wallpapers that showcase unique poses or seasonal themes for Sonic and his friends. In addition to artwork, [i]Sonic Channel[/i] has hosted short web comics featuring various members of the [i]Sonic[/i] cast, often capturing lighthearted moments or side adventures.

Apply this tag to artwork that depicts characters wearing exclusive official alternate outfits, adopting distinct poses, or referencing specific themes/scenes that originated from the official [i]Sonic Channel[/i] monthly artwork, comics, or other unique site features (and remain exclusive to it).

h4. External links

* "Official website":https://sonic.sega.jp
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/SonicOfficialJP

title: phee_kissthermite
body:
A female character from [[Motto! Haramase! Honoo no Oppai Isekai Ero Mahou Gakuen!]]

Measurements 
Height: 160cm 
Bust:127 (U-Cup)
Waist:55
Hips:84
First Year Student
Attribute: Combat Homunculus

Fee is a first year student who enrolled in Yuridrasil in order to improve her combat skills. She uses a magical gun as her primary weapon, and possesses the ability to change her body into a "bodysuit." Transforming consumes a great deal of magical power, and the effect is exacerbated upon reverting. She becomes excited and aroused during this time. She is very feminine, with a sharp and sincere personality. Her creator's name is Lufina
other_names: フィー=キステルミット

title: akai_haato
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[1st generation (hololive)|]], also known as "Haachama". Designed by [[Haruyuki (Yukichasoba)|]].

She has [[aqua eyes]], [[medium breasts|medium]]-to-[[large breasts]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with her bangs reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]. Her hairstyle consists of a [[one side up]] held by [[heart hair ornament]]s with the rest of her hair tied with [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]].

title: akai_haato_(7th_costume)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Akai Haato]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/akaihaato/status/1810662449517048296].

It's a [[carhop]] [[waitress]] uniform consisting of a [[red choker]], either a [[red shirt|red]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[double-breasted]] [[polka dot shirt]] or a [[layered bikini|layered]] [[bikini top only|bikini top]] with a [[name tag]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[polka dot skirt|polka dot]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[black garter straps]] connected to [[white thighhighs]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]]. She also has an optional [[hamburger hat]]

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, it consists of a pair of [[twintails|twin]] [[twin braids|braids]] tied with [[cherry hair ornament|cherry-shaped]] [[hair bobbles]] and decorated with a [[fork hair ornament|fork]] and [[knife hair ornament|knife]] [[hairclip]] on one side of her head and a ketchup bottle-shaped on the other.

title: akai_haato_(gothic_lolita)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Akai Haato]]. This is the costume that is best associated with her [i]Haachama[/i] persona.

It is a [[gothic lolita]] costume (designed by [[tsukana (saba mizore)|Saba Mizore]]) consisting of a [[short dress|short]] [[red dress|red]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[layered dress]] with a [[black belt]], [[black thighhighs]] a [[single legwear garter|single]] [[legwear garter]] and [[black boots]] [[lace-up boots]], she often wears a [[black capelet|black]] [[frilled capelet]] with a [[red bowtie]] and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], [[double-breasted]] [[black coat]] with a [[black skirt]] [[overskirt]] (although it's sometimes depicted as just a [[black dress]] and a [[red skirt]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[very long hair]] in a [[two side up]] decorated with a small [[hair bow]] with a [[black rose]], multiple [[hairclip]]s and several [[heart hair ornament]]s.

h4. Appearance

title: sono_bisque_doll_wa_koi_wo_suru
body:
A 2018-to-present manga series written & illustrated by [[Fukuda Shinichi]]. It began publishing January 19, 2018, and serialized in [i]Young Gangan[/i]. The series follows [[Gojou Wakana]], a high schooler who has a passion for making dolls and [[Kitagawa Marin]], his classmate who learns of this passion and shares her passion for cosplaying. With Gojou's skill in sewing, he helps Marin with her cosplays.

Also known as: Sono Kisekae Ningyou wa Koi wo Suru (KiseKoi). "Kisekae Ningyou" appears in the title with "Bisuku Dooru" above it in furigana.
English title: [i]My Dress-Up Darling[/i].

There is a Winter 2022 anime adaptation produced by [i]CloverWorks[/i].

h4. Characters

* [[Kitagawa Marin]]
* [[Gojou Wakana]]
* [[Inui Sajuna]]

title: lost_property_971_(lost_property_control_organization)
body:
A character created by [[amonitto]]  for [[samidare (hoshi)|Samidare]]'s [[lost property control organization (samidare)|Lost Property Control Organization]] universe. She is a Lost Property known as "Underground Idol-chan".

As her name suggests, she is a humanoid lost property who's active as an underground [[idol]], with a large number of zealous fans known as "The Choir". Several of her fans have ended up with their brain replaced with parasitic [[slug]]s.

She has [[blue hair]], [[sparkling eyes]], and a [[mole under mouth]]. Her daily wear consists of a [[black hat]], [[sunglasses]], a [[white shirt]] with a [[blue necktie]]. Her idol dress consists of a [[gothic lolita]] dress with [[tentacle wings]]. In both forms, she wears hair accessories shaped like tentacles, which are implied to be part of her body.

Her design was based on [[ebrietas daughter of the cosmos|Ebrietas, Daughter of the Cosmos]] from [[Bloodborne]].

title: marie_rose
body:
A character introduced in [[Dead or Alive 5]]: Ultimate.  

A [[gothic lolita]] from [[Sweden]]. She has [[blue eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[twintails]]. Usually depicted wearing an [[x hair ornament]] and [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s, but generally wears a [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[frilled dress]], [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[black sleeves]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[thigh strap]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].

In December 2020, she received the skin [[Marie Rose (Devilish Servant Against the Splashing Waves)]] as part of a collab with [[Azur Lane]].

title: popsicle
body:
Also known as [b]Ice pop[/b], [b]ice lolly[/b], [b]ice block[/b], [b]ice drop[/b], [b]ice gola[/b], or [b]ice candy[/b].
A frozen, flavored, ice-based snack on a stick.

It is often portrayed [[melting]] and [[dripping]] in the [[hot|heat]] while a character [[eating|eats]] it, sometimes in a [[sexually suggestive]] manner.

On Danbooru it is used for generic ice pops, not necessarily for the "Popsicle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Popsicle_%28brand%29 name brand.

h4. See also

* [[Watermelon bar]]
* [[Tag group:Food tags]]

title: butcher
body: A person who specializes in preparing and selling [[meat]]. They're skilled in cutting, deboning, and trimming various types of meat from [[animal]]s like [[cow|cattle]], [[pig]]s, poultry, and [[lamb]]. Butchers typically work in dedicated butcher shops, meat [[market]]s, or in the meat departments of [[grocery store]]s and [[supermarket]]s.

title: shirakami_fubuki_(aristocrat_kei)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shirakami Fubuki]], revealed on her 2020 birthday special.

Her aristocratic [[lolita fashion|lolita]] outfit is [[victorian]]/[[steampunk]]-inspired and consists of a dark [[blue jacket]] with [[sleeve cuffs]], a [[mini top hat]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a combination of a [[blue bowtie]] and an [[ascot]] an [[underbust]] [[black corset]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] knee-length [[frilled skirt]], [[white gloves]], and a [[white pantyhose]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[very long hair]] tied into a [[braided ponytail]] with a [[black hairband]].

Her cyberpunk costume consists of a two-layered [[strapless]](?) [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress|white]] [[microdress]] under a [[white jacket|white]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]]. A [[black choker]] with [[dog tags]] and [[white boots]]. This costume has often been noted to be similar to the general design style of [[Arknights]].

title: kaela_kovalskia_(1st_costume)
body:
The original default costume for [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Kaela Kovalskia]], which she retired for her [[kaela kovalskia (4th costume)|current default]] on her 3rd anniversary.

It consists of a [[black scarf]], a [[long dress|long]] [[white dress|white]] [[skintight]]/[[impossible dress|impossible]] [[pencil dress]] with a [[fur collar]], [[black sleeves|black]] [[gloved sleeves]] and a [[side slit]] revealing a [[bodystocking]]/[[see-through legwear|see-through]] [[pantyhose]] underneath, a [[single glove|single]] [[red gloves|red]] welding glove on her left hand, a [[red belt]] with several tool including three small metal plates and a [[mallet]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[open coat|open]] [[black coat]] which she wears [[off shoulder]] [[coat partially removed|resting on her elbows]] and [[black footwear]] [[platform boots|platform]] [[ankle boots]] with red [[colored shoe soles]]. She also wears a miniature steel bar as a [[single earring]] on her left ear.

title: yuzuriha_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is a cheerful young lady whose family has ties to the faction, Night Blade. She uses a type of Iaijutsu technique that is learned by descendants of her family. She affectionately calls her sword "Ayame-chan". Yuzuriha and [[Kido hyde|Hyde]] were once childhood friends until an unspecified incident occurred which split them apart from each other. Hyde, to this day, he still feels guilty about what happened that day. 


Yuzuriha is the only character to switch voice actors between the first game and its sequel. This is due to her original voice actor, [[Fujimura Ayumi]] going on indefinite hiatus in 2019. The role of Yuzuriha would then be passed onto [[Nabatame Hitomi]].

Yuzuriha makes a cameo appearance as a background character in [[Skullgirls]]. She appears in a stage called River King Casino.


h5. Voice Actresses

[b]JP:[/b] [[Fujimura Ayumi]]/[[Nabatame Hitomi]] [b]EN:[/b] [[Erica Lindbeck]]


h4. External links

* "Yuzuriha Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Yuzuriha

title: koganei_niko
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and member of of [[hololive DEV_IS]]' second group [[FLOW GLOW (hololive)|]]. Designed by [[Tetsukazu]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[blue eyes]] with [[yellow pupils|yellow]] [[slit pupils]]. Her default hairstyle is [[straight hair|straight]] [[parted hair]] with [[blunt ends]], [[curtained hair|curtained]] [[parted bangs]] and a long [[side braid]].

Her default costume consists of a [[black jacket]] [[letterman jacket|letterman]] [[sukajan]] with a [[tiger print|tiger]] motif, a [[black shirt|black]] [[see-through shirt|see-through]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[halter shirt]] worn over a [[black tank top]] with [[criss-cross back-straps]], [[grey pants|grey]] [[torn pants|torn]] [[sweatpants]] with [[knee cutout]] and [[black boots|black]] [[lace-up boots]]. She also wears [[multiple rings]] and has optional [[round eyewear|round]] [[orange-tinted eyewear|orange-tinted]] [[sunglasses]].

h4. Costumes

title: korean_text
body:
The image contains text written in the Korean language.

The most common writing system in Korean today is Hangul (also known as Chosongul in the North), a syllabic alphabet, but in the past [[traditional Chinese text|Chinese characters]] were used to represent words as well (referred to as Hanja), whether exclusively or mixed with Hangul. There are also ways to romanize Korean, generally referred to as [[Romaja text|Romaja]].

h4. See also

* [[Romaja text]]
* [[Tag group:Text]]

title: tachibana_hibiki_(symphogear)
body:
She's one of the six main protagonists of the [[Senki Zesshou Symphogear]] series.

She is a Symphogear user and wields the Gungnir relic.

Hibiki has orange eyes with short light brown hair fastened with two red clips on either side of her head. She is most often seen wearing the uniform of Lydian Music Academy.

Hibiki has a [[scar on chest|scar on her chest]] in the shape of a 'forte' from when [[Amou Kanade|Kanade's]] Gungnir fragment pierced her chest on the day of the Zwei Wing concert.

h4. See also

* [[Tachibana Hibiki (Another) (Symphogear)|]]

title: tachibana_hibiki_(another)_(symphogear)
body: An alternate reality version of [[tachibana hibiki (symphogear)|Hibiki]]. She looks almost identical to the regular one with the easiest way to tell them apart being their eyes. Regular Hibiki has [[tareme]] eyes while Another Hibiki has [[tsurime]] eyes.

Headed a doujin group called SYOKKIRI PRO-WRES alongside [[Yoshimatsu Takahiro]], the two having frequently "traveled":https://twitter.com/kyasuko/status/1522460353371983872 together to America to attend WWE events. [b]Made in Wario[/b] (Japanese), [b]WarioWare[/b] (English)

It has seen releases on the [[Game Boy Advance]] (inc. a tilt-sensor game), [[GameCube]], [[Nintendo DS]] & [[nintendo_dsi|DSi]], [[Wii]], [[Wii U]], [[Nintendo 3DS]], and [[nintendo switch|Switch]]. title: batman_ninja
body:
[i][b]Batman Ninja[/b][/i] (ニンジャバットマン, [i]Ninja Battoman[/i]) is a 2018 Japanese anime superhero film directed by Mizusaki Junpei, produced by Warner Bros., and animated by Kamikaze Douga and YamatoWorks, which features the [[DC Comics]] character [[Batman]]. 

Okazaki Takashi, the creator of [[Afro Samurai]], is the character designer for this anime movie. 

The film was released in the United States in digital format on April 24, 2018; it was released in physical formats on May 8 and was released theatrically in Japan on June 15 of the same year.

title: one-seven
body:
The titular [[Daitetsujin 17]].

Its popularity would inspire the inclusion of a giant robot in another Toei [[tokusatsu]] production, in the form of [[Spider-Man (toei)|]]'s [[Leopardon]], which would result in [[Super Sentai]] debuting giant robots, starting with [[Battle Fever J]]'s [[Battle Fever Robo]].

title: saenai_heroine_no_sodatekata
body:
[b]Saenai Heroine no Sodatekata[/b] (abbrev. [b]Saekano[/b], English: [b]How to Raise a Boring Girlfriend[/b]) is a series of light novels written by Maruto Fumiaki with illustrations by [[Misaki Kurehito]].

The story follows [[Aki Tomoya]], a high school student who recruits his friends to help him create a visual novel based on his classmate, [[Katou Megumi]].

The series has received multiple adaptations: a manga series with art by [[Moriki Takeshi]] (and two further manga spinoff series), an anime series with two seasons by [[A-1 Pictures]], a [[Playstation Vita]] visual novel, and a movie by [[CloverWorks]] that premiered October 2019.

h4. Characters

* [[Aki Tomoya]]
* [[Hashima Izumi]]
* [[Hyoudou Michiru]]
* [[Kasumigaoka Utaha]]
* [[Katou Megumi]]
* [[Sawamura Spencer Eriri]]

h4.See also
* [[Toyogasaki Academy school uniform]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (EN): Saekano: How to Raise a Boring Girlfriend":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saekano:_How_to_Raise_a_Boring_Girlfriend
* "Wikipedia (JP): Saenai Heroine no Sodatekata":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/冴えない彼女の育てかた]
* "Wikipedia (JP): Maruto Fumiaki":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/丸戸史明]
* "Fujimi Fantasia Bunko: Saenai Heroine no Sodatekata":[https://fantasiabunko.jp/sp/201211heroine/]
* "Anime Official Site":https://www.saenai.tv/
* "Saekano Movie Site":https://saenai-movie.com/

title: weapon_on_back
body:
A [[weapon]] worn on the back. Use the applicable weapon tag (often [[sword]] or [[rifle]]) together with this tag.

See [[holding weapon behind back]] when the weapon is being held behind the back with the hands. Use this tag when the weapon is worn on the back.

h4. See also

title: holding_over_opposite_shoulder
body:
[[holding_weapon|Holding a weapon]] or an object over own opposite shoulder.
It often appears in the scene with [[incoming attack]], and shows the posture of arm around own neck / [[arm across neck]].
If it's [[weapon over shoulder]] with both hands, just add [[two-handed]].

h4. See also

title: leopardon
body:
[[Spider-Man|Spider-Man's]] [[mecha]] from the 1970's [[tokusatsu]] [[Spider-Man (Toei)|TV show]].

This mecha was included due to the popularity of a previous Toei robot, [[One-Seven]] from [[Daitetsujin 17]], and would ultimately be responsible for popularizing giant robots in tokusatsu, especially [[Super Sentai]], which has utilized giant robots since [[Battle Fever J]].

title: ranger_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy aircraft carrier USS [i]Ranger[/i] (CV-4). Character design by [[Hoshiakari (C2 Kikan)]]. Voiced by Natsuko Abe.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[braid]] and [[hair bun]] on the side, [[blue eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[two-tone dress]] colored white and Navy Blue, a [[blue skirt]], [[blue necktie]], [[white panties]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[boots]]. 

Her rigging consists of her real-life island superstructure on her right, a 12.7 cm single gun mount on her left, and her real-life [[flight deck]] used as a portable case.

She is portrayed as a [[drunk]]ard for reasons that have yet to be determined.

In real life, [i]Ranger[/i] was the US Navy's first aircraft carrier designed and built from scratch. In [[World War II]], she primarily saw combat in the Atlantic and Mediterranean theaters as her comparatively slow speed, minimal armor, and limited plane capacity prevented her from seeing service in the Pacific other than training duties from 1944 onward.

h4. Appearance

title: houston_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Houston[/i] (CL/CA-30), fifth of the [i]Northampton[/i]-class cruisers.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She wears a stylized [[naval uniform]] with a [[white hat|white]] [[peaked cap]], a [[corset]], [[detached sleeves]], a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], [[black_pantyhose|black]] [[thighband pantyhose]], [[shin guards]], and [[high_heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of a smokestack, a [[crane (machine)|]], and two large cannon [[ship turret|turret]]s, each having three barrels.

The historical [i]Houston[/i] was launched in 1929 and was sunk by torpedoes in the Battle of Sunda Strait, on March 1st, 1942.

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Batavia Princess]]. 

h4. Appearance

title: honolulu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Honolulu[/i] (CL-48). Character design by [[Ugume]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied in [[twin drills]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[large breasts]]. She wears a stylized [[military uniform]] composed of a [[crop top]] which exposes the underside of her breasts, a [[sleeveless dress|sleevess]] [[blue_dress|blue]] [[pleated dress]] and a white [[overskirt]] as well as [[black thighhighs]] and [[rudder_footwear|rudder boots]].  Her [[rigging]] consists of her twin [[smokestack]]s at her back and [[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]s at her sides.

Her voice lines give her the impression of being a non-native Hawaii resident who greets and blurts out phrases in the "Hawaiian language":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawaiian_language] and has immersed herself somewhat in the culture of the Hawaiian archipelago.

The historical USS [i]Honolulu[/i] served in the attack on Pearl Harbor, Battle of Tassafaronga, the Battle of Kula Gulf, the Battle of Kolombangara and the Battle of Peleliu. She was taken out of action by serious torpedo damage just before the Battle of Leyte Gulf. She was repaired, but not in time to rejoin the war. She was decommissioned in 1947 and was held in reserve until she was scrapped in 1959, by which time, her namesake city had become the capital of the 50th state to join the Union.

title: triangular_headpiece
body:
A type of headband sometimes worn by [[ghost]]s in Japanese folklore.

Derived from Edo period burial rituals, it was originally intended to protect the newly deceased from evil spirits. It has various regional names, [i]Hitai-eboshi[/i], [i]Tenkan[/i], [i]Houkan[/i], [i]Kami-kaburi[/i], and so on.

title: ra-class_destroyer
body:
Common destroyer-class enemies, first introduced in the KanColle Operation Rei-Go 1944 stage play, and introduced into [[Kantai Collection]] proper during the Spring 2025 event. They are the only "normal enemy" aside from the imps with voice lines. Based on the art, they are assumed to be Abyssal forms of [[United States Navy]] destroyers, particularly of the [i]Allen M. Sumner[/i]-class.

Also unlike previous common enemies, the Ra-class has five separate forms: [[ra-class destroyer alpha|Alpha]], [[ra-class destroyer beta|Beta]], [[ra-class destroyer gamma|Gamma]], [[ra-class destroyer delta|Delta]], and [[ra-class destroyer zeta|Zeta]].

The following differences separate the forms:
* Alpha has [[long hair]], [[horns]] growing out of her hat, and a completely [[white necktie]].
* Beta has [[short hair]] that [[hair over one eye|completely covers her right eye]], [[spikes]] out of her hat, and a [[multicolored necktie]] that starts at white at the knot, and changes to red/yellow down her body. She also has [[long fingernails]] growing out of her black gloves, and is seen licking her lips.
* Gamma has [[long hair]] that comes down in one braid, [[hair between eyes]], and neither spikes nor horns growing out of her hat. She is festooned with [[red bow]]s in her hair, on her dress, and even decorating her equipment, and has a joyous [[:D]] expression on her face.
* Delta has [[twintails]] hair that [[hair over one eye|completely covers her left eye]], [[spikes]] out of her hat, and a completely [[red necktie]]. Unlike the other Ra-classes, Delta has [[multicolored gloves]] black and red [[elbow gloves]] that extend into the sleeves of her dress, and [[red straps]] atop her shoes.
* Zeta, in complete contrast to the others, has [[white hair]], a completely [[covered face]], a [[transparent necktie]], and [[garter straps]] connected to the horns out of her knees, with [[anchor]]s dangling from them. Her black dress is reconfigured into a [[showgirl skirt]], showing off the [[black panties]] on her hips.

h4. Appearances
* !post #9050165: Alpha
* !post #9050188: Beta
* !post #9050209: Gamma
* !post #9050225: Delta
* !post #9050253: Zeta

title: priest_(aoe)
body:
A unit in the [[Age of Empires]] strategy game that can heal friendly units and convert enemy ones. He has the appearance of an elderly man with balding [[white hair]] tied in a [[low ponytail]], wearing white robes with sashes of the player's color, and wielding a [[shepherd's crook]].

This unit's infamous ability to convert enemies is the source of the [[Wololo (meme)|]] meme, named after the chant that it repeats during the conversion process.

This unit was replaced by the [[Monk (Age of Empires II)|]] in the sequel game [[Age of Empires II]].

Changes from her base form include: losing the gauntlets and wearing simple [[black gloves]] in their place, a sleeker design for her [[headphones]], and [[uneven legwear]] with her left sock looking more like a [[single thighhigh]]. Her glasses also change to [[under-rim eyewear]].

title: odin_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Odin[/b] is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A spell caster who serves [[leo (fire emblem fates)|Leo]]. In order to create cool critical attacks, he does nothing but research magic all day and night. Often, he claims his roused power runs wild although actual harm is not likely.

He is voiced by Takahashi Hidenori in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Dark Mage

h4. Appearance

* !post #2619757

h4. See also

* [[Owain (Fire Emblem)|]] - His original appearance in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]

title: owain_(fire_emblem)
body:
Owain (ウード Eudes) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

He is voiced by Takahashi Hidenori in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Myrmidon
 
A hot-blooded youth with a passion for legendary heroes and, more importantly, their legendary weapons. He almost constantly speaks in a theatrical manner, concocting extensive narratives about himself as a chosen hero cursed with an uncontrollable sword hand which thirsts for the blood of his enemies. Often, he claims his roused power runs wild although actual harm is not likely.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3545797

h4.See also

* [[Odin (Fire Emblem)|]] - his appearance in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]

title: laslow_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Laslow[/b] (ラズワルド, [i]Razuwarudo[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A swordsman who serves [[xander (fire emblem)|Xander]]. He has a bright outgoing personality, and is friendly enough to mingle with anyone. He loves girls, and playing seducer in his free time seems to be enough for him. Dancing is his specialty.

He is voiced by Kijima Ryūichi in the Japanese version.

title: fuzzy_(splatoon)
body:
Fuzzyness is a physical condition in the [[splatoon_(series)|Splatoon]] series, it was introduced in the single player campaign of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]]. 

The condition are afflicted upon [[inkling|Inklings]], [[octoling|Octolings]] and [[octarian_(enemy)|Octarians]] when they come into contact with [[Fuzzy Ooze|]], a marble-patterned pink, blue and yellow substance which makes them transform into strange mammalian/cephalopod hybrids.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25330119: Fuzzy [[Octarian_(enemy)|Octarians]] appear much like their non-fuzzy selves, except the sclera of their eyes resemble fuzzy ooze and the colored sides of their bodies are covered in a brown, carpet-like texture.
* !asset #25065418: [[Fuzzy_Octoling|Fuzzy Octolings]] are distinguished from their non-fuzzy counterparts by their tentacles being covered in a type of fur similar to that on the fuzzy Octarians, as well as also having brown skin, purple lipstick and a fondness for [[skin tight]] leather and [[leopard print]] clothing.
* !asset #25330081: The player if they touch Fuzzy Ooze, having been transformed into a ball of fluff that can only helplessly roll around on the floor.

title: balrog_(doukutsu_monogatari)
body:
Balrog is a character in [[Doukutsu Monogatari]] (Cave Story). He is a typical "idiotic recurring villain" in that you fight him multiple times, he isn't actually very evil, and he's completely ineffective as a villain either way. He often accompanies [[Misery (doukutsu monogatari)|]] as she does [[Date Fuyuhiko|The Doctor]]'s bidding.

His peculiar, rectangular-shaped body made fans think he was [[toaster]] or a [[lunchbox]], though it was later confirmed his design was based off of a [[bar soap|bar of soap]].

[spoiler]
In the game's best ending, Balrog swoops in after the destruction of the Demon Crown to save Quote and Curly. The three of them decide to live together after the ending.
[/spoiler]

title: candlelight
body:
Settings where [[candle|candles]] provide the majority of ambient light. This makes for dark scenes with amber-colored light radiating out from the candles themselves.

This tag is not to be used when there's merely a lit candle in the image. It needs to be a dark setting illuminated by the light given off by at least one candle.

h4.Correct examples
* !post #6579769: The candle is the main light source of what is otherwise a dark setting
* !post #8324191: [[Birthday cake]]'s candle is creating a warm, amber glow

h4.Incorrect examples
* !post #6276898: The candle is merely lit
* !post #2421339: The main light source is from the [[window]], not the candles on the [[birthday cake]]

title: fuzzy_ooze
body:
Fuzzy Ooze is a liquid substance in the [[Splatoon (series)]] it was introduced in the single player campaign of [[Splatoon 3]]. 

It is a fur-covered, marble-patterned pink, blue and yellow substance which makes [[inkling|inklings]], [[octoling|octolings]] and [[octarian_(enemy)|octarians]] transform into [[fuzzy_(splatoon)|]] mammalian/cephalopod hybrid-versions of themselves on contact.

* !asset #25330199: Fuzzy Ooze as it appears in-game.

title: sanitized_(splatoon)
body:
Sanitization is a physical condition in the [[splatoon_(series)|Splatoon]] series, it was introduced in the paid DLC of [[Splatoon 2|]], the [[Splatoon_2:_Octo_Expansion|Octo Expansion]]. Where it is frequently featured on the campaign's [[Octarian (enemy)|]] and [[takozonesu|Octoling]] enemies. The affliction is not exclusive to them however, as non-hostile characters such as Acht have been Sanitized as well.

h4. Appearance
They are shown to have a different coloration, depending on their "level of sanitization". Their skin is pale green/blue, they have [[black sclera]] with neon-blue pupils, and their hair has a blue color, sometimes with a green gradient. 
* !asset #25330126: [[Octarian (enemy)|]]s as they appear after having been sanitized.
* !asset #25330248: Sanitized [[takozonesu|Octolings]]. The common Octolings having blue hair and Elite Octolings having black hair.
* !asset #25330327: Acht (also known as [[Dedf1sh]]) is another sanitized subject.

h4. External links
* "Inkipedia: Sanitized Octarian":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Sanitized_Octarian]

title: torogao
body:
A facial expression where the character appears to be in an ecstatic, yet quiet and unresponsive trance with their face almost melting in pleasure.

The cheeks look [[blush|flushed]], the eyebrows are slanted downwards towards the sides, and the eyes are half-open and [[tears|moist]], often staring into the distance. It is common to see [[saliva|drool]] and a [[open mouth|half-open mouth]] as well.  The limbs and joints may be relaxed and hanging loosely in place.

May also involve [[heavy breathing]] or a contented [[smile]].

h4. Examples
* !post #1164935

It is often sexual in nature, but not always. It may also be seen when a character is eating their favorite food, for example. 

Not to be confused with [[ahegao]], which is a more wild expression. Torogao indicates trance-like pleasure.

h4. See also
* [[fucked silly]]
* [[Tag Group:Face Tags]]

title: tattooed_teenage_alien_fighters_from_beverly_hills
body: Western live-action series created by DIC Entertainment. It follows four teens who are picked by an alien to fight off monsters using the powers of constellations as the Galactic Sentinels, wearing sleeveless spandex and half-cowl masks, with the ability to become giant. One of the rare attempts at Western [[tokusatsu]] during the 90s, alongside Saban's [[Mystic Knights of Tir Na Nog]], with DIC producing the series at the same time as [[Superhuman Samurai Syber-Squad]] (which they produced with [[Tsuburaya Productions]], which has contributed to rumors that this show was originally intended to be an adaptation of [[Andro Melos (series)|]]).
other_names: タトゥード・ティーンエイジ・エイリアン・ファイターズ・フロム・ビバリーヒルズ

title: bustier
body:
A firm-fitting undergarment, usually worn as [[lingerie]], designed to push up the [[breasts]]. A bustier resembles a [[bra]], but longer, extending beneath the breasts to cover part of the waist and stomach. The length may vary, but a bustier usually ends above the [[navel]].

The difference between a bustier and a [[corset]] is that a corset has laces or buttons in front, is usually longer and made of stronger material, usually doesn't cup the breasts, and is usually is tighter around the waist. A bustier is usually shorter (above the navel), usually cups the breasts, and is designed mainly to hold up the breasts, not to hold in the waist.

In addition, a bustier should not be confused with an [[underbust]], which denotes attire worn below—and not on—the breasts.

h4. Examples

* post #314129
* post #434924
* post #546192
* post #3970140—A bustier worn with an underbust

h4. See also

* [[corset]]
* [[Tag group:Attire]]

title: foyer
body:
Traditionally a [[foyer]] was a large, open lobby/reception area in public buildings such as [[theater]]s and [[hotel]]s. The term has since evolved (especially in North America) to refer to the small landing by the front door of houses and apartments where one stores their keys, jackets, puts on their [[shoes]], etc.

The Japanese version is a genkan (玄関; https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genkan).

title: cars_(movie)
body:
[[Pixar]]'s seventh film, released in theaters on June 9, 2006. The film is set in an alternate universe where each character is a variety of vehicle, whether [[car]], [[airplane]], or [[watercraft]]. The film focuses on a novice racer named "[[Lightning McQueen]]" who discovers the lost town of Radiator Springs on his way to the most important race of his life.

Would kickstart a series of films, with Cars 2 in 2011, and Cars 3 in 2017, alongside other media.

h4. Movies

* Cars 1
* Cars 2
* Cars 3

h4. See also
* [[Planes (Disney)|]] (Spin-off to the franchise, despite not being produced by Pixar)

title: monsters_inc.
body:
A 2001 American computer animated film by Pixar, as well as their fourth movie.

It involves a monster world that is powered by the screams of human children, who they believe are toxic. When [[Boo (monsters inc.)|one child]] escapes into the monster world, [[James P. Sullivan|Sulley]] and [[Mike Wazowski|Mike]] must return her before it's too late.

A [[Monsters University|prequel]] was released in 2013.

title: x-men_vs._street_fighter
body:
[b][i]X-MEN VS. STREET FIGHTER[/i][/b] is a [[1996]] [[crossover]] fighting game developed by [[Capcom]], released for arcades, [[Sega Saturn]] [i](Japan only)[/i], and [[PlayStation 1]]. In collaboration with [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]], this would be the third fighting game made by the joint companies. It was the first game to introduce 2-on-2 tag team fighting in the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series, featuring characters from [[X-Men]] and [[Street Fighter]] respectively. The game also introduced new mechanics such as Variable Combination and Variable Counter. 

The game's "intro":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8UWgGcRHCgU is noteworthy for its iconic handshake between Ryu and Cyclops which has been parodied by fans.

title: tatsumaki_senpuukyaku
body:
The [b]Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku[/b] (竜巻旋風脚, "Tornado Whirlwind Leg") is a special move primarily used by [[Ryu (street fighter)|Ryu]] and [[Ken Masters|Ken]] in [[Street Fighter]], seeing the user spin through the air with a tornado-like kick.

Each variation of this move differs depending on the character and game; for instance, Ryu's version will hit once with a strong kick, while Ken's hit's up to three times―depending on the button pressed. Akuma's has multiple hits but also allows him to easily combo into a [[Shouryuuken]]. In earlier versions of [[Street Fighter II (series)|]], this move functioned identically for both Ryu and Ken, hitting up to three times and having the universal property of passing over projectiles.

h4. Variations

* Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku (竜巻旋風脚)

title: niko_(lost_property_control_organization)
body:
Niko is a character from [[Lost Property Control Organization (samidare)|]], a series created by [[Samidare (Hoshi)]]. He is Lost Property 025, known as the "Angel's Ring", possessing healing abilities, and appears to be a [[child|young]] boy with a [[halo]] floating above his head. He is classified as a B-class lost property. The halo on his head enlarges as he takes damage. 

[spoiler]He died during childbirth and was revived by an unknown party as Lost Property 025's parasitic host. Once the halo on his head grows large enough, it becomes a portal for the Divine Vessel (降神器), one of the possible final bosses of the game.[/spoiler]

He has [[short hair|short]], [[blonde hair]], light [[blue eyes]], and wears a [[dress shirt]] under a [[grey sweater vest]], with [[black shorts]].

title: qalaisa_(arknights)
body:
A formerly unnamed Sarkaz woman from the fourth [[Arknights]] Integrated Strategies, [i]Expeditioner's Jǫklumarkar[/i], or just "IS4".

She first appears in the encounter node "Northwind Witch" that triggers a battle, similar to those of:

* An unidentified Cautus's encounter node "Damsel in Distress" in IS1, [i]Ceobe's Fungimist[/i].
* [[Chained Sarkaz Girl]]'s encounter node "Shackled Bloodline" in IS2, [i]Crimson Solitaire[/i].
* [[Dancing Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Dancing Chests" in IS3, [i]Mizuki & Caerula Arbor[/i].
* [[Praying Sankta Nun (arknights)|]]'s encounter node "The Pious Worshiper" from IS5, [i]Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables[/i].

She was later introduced as an NPC in the Story Collection "A Kazdelian Rescue". Her real name, Qalaiša, was revealed in the web event acting as a teaser to IS5.

Typically has [[black horns]], [[black hair]], overall [[black clothes]] with a [[white ribbon]] and one visible white [[earrings|earring]] with [[pointy ears]], [[blue eyes]], and has what appears to be a black [[picnic basket]].
other_names: 北風の魔女(アークナイツ)

title: speed_star_(sonic)
body:
[[Sonic the Hedgehog]]'s personal sports  car, prominently featured in racing games such as [[Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing]], [[Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed]], and [[Team Sonic Racing]].

The Speed Star has undergone various design changes across different games. In Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing, it appears as a blue convertible with distinctive features like six "spikes" and Sonic's head emblem on the front. In Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed, the car can transform into a plane and a boat, each with unique designs suited for different terrains. In Team Sonic Racing, the Speed Star received a redesign with a slightly less bulky appearance and more realistic-looking wheels.

title: jpeg_artifacts
body:
A kind of compression artifact.

Prevalent in images uploaded from [[Twitter]] and [[Facebook]].

These can be either blockiness or mosquito noise and are usually seen in areas with high contrast, such as near lines. If in doubt, refer to some of the images with this tag. 

This tag should be used for images where these artifacts are noticeable when viewed normally, without zooming in or enhancing the contrast.

h4. Example
* !asset #22891347: An image devoid of artifacts (sourced from post #8012139)
* !asset #22891358: The same image, but with visible artifacts (sourced from post #8012103)

h4. See also

* [[tag group:image composition]]
* [[aliasing]] 
* [[scan artifacts]] 
* [[lossy-lossless]]
* [[duplicate]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Compression artifact":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compression_artifact

title: itsallfeynman

title: scan_artifacts
body:
Artifacts made due to poor [[scan|scanning]]:

* [[binding discoloration]]: The Image gets blurry as the perspective warps to either side due to the page bending
* [[bleed through]]: Visible contour of illustrations from the opposite side of the page
* [[color halftone]]: Visible printing dots, usually in a high definition scan
* [[color issue]]: The color of the image seems far from ideal, it may be low contrast between blacks and whites, over-saturation, or even the hue shifting. Can either be the result of poor or lack of editing, deterioration of the paper
* [[crease]]: Bending marks
* [[scan dust]]: Debris opacating the original illustration

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Image composition]]
* [[Tag group:scan]]

body:
Unofficial name for a [[quality|terribly designed]] Chinese [[Saber (fate)|]] ([[Fate/stay night]]) [[figure]].  When pictures of the figure were originally posted on [[4chan]], the person posting the images called her "Sader" and the name stuck. It had reached a somewhat cult status in Japan and this particular figure is highly sought after by some, including Miyagawa Takeshi, the sculptor of the "Original" Saber figure that "inspired" the Sader figure.

title: selena:_tempest_(pgr)
body:
The Uniframe of [[Selena (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. Namesake is the stage play written by William Shakespeare, The Tempest.

h4. Appearance
Selena has [[purple eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[black hair]], has features like [[single sidelock]] (left side), [[blunt bangs]], [[colored inner hair]] ([[blue hair|blue]] or [[red hair|red]] inner), hair [[parted hair|parts]] into two at the lower back. Her hair is adorned with a single [[hair ribbon]] on the right side, wears a pair of [[earrings]].

The Tempest frame has many [[mechabare]] elements integrated into the body, she can be tagged as [[cyborg]] depending on the level of mechanical details depicted. Both arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] as well as her left [[mechanical legs|leg]] ([[single mechanical leg]]), both feet are [[mechanical foot|mechanical]], but depending on depiction, right foot might look like a [[black footwear|black]] [[boots|boot]] ([[asymmetrical footwear]]). Has [[robot joints]] at her elbow, wrist, knee and ankle.

Her apparel is a [[black dress|black]] [[armored dress]], with [[puffy long sleeves]], a [[black bow|black]] [[waist bow]], and skirt with [[pleated skirt|pleated]] design. No other apparel on the lower body.

Depending on awakening level of the character depicted, her hair ribbon can be replaced by two [[hairclip]]s, and her skirt armor plates can be depicted [[glowing armor|glowing]]. She uses a weaponized [[cello]] in combat, but the acoustic chamber is missing entirely, and the endpin is a blade. Also carries the [[bow (music)|bow]] to play the cello.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[selena: tempest (nightingale and rose) (pgr)|Nightingale and Rose]]
* [[selena: tempest (aria of nymph) (pgr)|Aria of Nymph]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Selena: Tempest Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Selena:_Tempest/Gallery]

title: sharkspeare_(pgr)
body:
Shark-speare is an enemy boss from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]] who also serves as the game's mascot after their debut.

Shark-speare is a [[robot]] [[shark]] (bipedal with four limbs and [[shark tail]]) in a [[yellow coat|yellow]] [[hooded coat|hooded]] [[raincoat]], with his [[hood up]] at all times, its [[shark fin]] is exposed through the hood. Shark-speare is a slightly [[damaged]], and has [[bandaid]]s around the body.

Shark-speare has a second phase form, where the head casing is removed and the internal mechanical head is exposed, clothing becomes [[torn clothes|torned]] and [[exposed internal machinery]] becomes visible. Gains two pairs of [[mechanical wings]] and [[thrusters]] and uses its removed head casing as a melee weapon.

title: lilith_(pgr)
body:
Lilith the Magician, an enemy boss from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], and later on a playable character. She is an Ascendent of the Ascension Network, working under [[Vonnegut (pgr)|]]. Her boss appearance is the same as the stage 2 ascension of her [[lilith: daemonissa (pgr)|Daemonissa]] frame. Voiced by [[Serizawa Yuu]].

Lilith has [[pale skin]], light [[purple eyes]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[blunt ends]], she wears a magician style [[top hat]], [[dice earrings]], and has a [[spade (shape)|]] [[facial tattoo|tattoo]] under her right eye. All four of her limbs are mechanical, [[mechanical arms]] are connected just above the elbow while her [[mechanical legs]] are connected just above the knee.

Clothing consist of a [[black tailcoat|black]] [[sleeveless jacket|sleeveless]] [[tailcoat]], [[black shorts]] with [[fishnet pantyhose]]. Uses a weaponised [[umbrella]] in combat.

title: trailblazer_(pgr)
body:
Trailblazer (Previously translated as Radiant Marcher) is a NPC, enemy boss and a limited time playable character from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], a mechanoid associated with the Church of Machina, and the current holder of the title 'Chariot'.

A [[mecha]] [[robot]], body painted primarily in white, black and red, gold accented trims in various locations. Has four arms ([[extra arms]]), a pair of smaller and more humanoid appearance arms growing out of the torso, and a pair of larger mechanised arms on the shoulder. body:
A [[sukeban]] themed [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Yata (PGR)|]]'s [[Yata: Fulgor (PGR)|Fulgor frame]], similar to the style of [[Saotome Yuuka (pgr)|]]'s.

Retaining the same [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] hairstyle, contrasting the default Fulgor appearance, the Higanbana coating has no mechanical element at all except for the orange flat [[cable]]s leading into the [[elbow cutout]]s.

The outfit is a set of [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[black shirt|black]] [[sailor shirt]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[puffy sleeves]], and a [[red neckerchief]]. Lower body apparels consist of a thigh length [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]], a pair of [[grey socks]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]]. Both the skirt and socks are torn in areas ([[torn skirt]], [[torn socks]]).

Other elements include a [[black choker]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[red gloves]], and a red [[jacket around waist|jacket tied around waist]].

body:
A character created by [[amonitto]] in response to [[Lost Property Control Organization (samidare)|]], a series by [[Samidare (hoshi)]]. She is from the Holy Relic Protection Church, a rival group to the [[protagonist (lost property control organization)|Protagonist's]] organization.

She has [[medium hair|medium length]], [[blonde hair]], [[green eyes|green]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] eyes, and wears a stylized [[nun]] habit over a [[school uniform]]. Likes [[youkan (food)|]].

title: yata:_fulgor_(pgr)
body:
The playable version of [[Yata (PGR)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]

h4. Appearance
Yata's Fulgor frame is highly mechanised in appearance with a lot of [[mechabare]] elements, possibly eligible for [[cyborg]]/[[android]] tags. She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], typically [[hair over one eye|covering one of her eyes]], her eye colour is [[yellow eyes|yellow]]. All four limbs are mechanical, [[mechanical legs]] are jointed above the knee and her [[mechanical arms]] are jointed at the elbow, though the [[long sleeves]] covers most of her arms, flat [[cable]]s can be seen going into the [[elbow cutout]] and her orange [[mechanical hands]] are visible.

Her only clothing apparel is a [[white jacket|white]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[puffy sleeves|puffy]] [[detached sleeves]], and a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]]. She uses [[martial arts]] in combat, and her weapon is a back mounted device that can expand into four [[extra arms|extra]] [[mechanical arms]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[yata: fulgor (higanbana) (pgr)|Higanbana]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Yata: Fulgor Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Yata:_Fulgor/Gallery]

title: garry's_mod
body:
Sandbox physics game created by Garry Newman and developed by Facepunch Studios on PC.

The game was originally a mod for [[valve_software|Valve Corporation]]'s [[Half-Life 2]] Death Match, but was made a standalone game in 2006 for Windows. An OS X version was released in 2010, and a Linux version was released in 2013.

The game has no set objective and instead gives the player the freedom to make his/her own maps, add ragdolls to the map, and manipulate the ragdolls.

Due to its freedom, players or developers are able to make custom game modes for Garry's Mod, such as "Trouble in Terrorist Town":[https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/gamemodes/Trouble_In_Terrorist_Town] and "Murder":[https://github.com/MechanicalMind/murder]. Content creators can also use its freedom to make videos through stop motion of ragdolls and props posing for frames and rendering them into a GMod video.

Garry's Mod runs on the [i]Source[/i] engine made by [[valve software|Valve]], along with other games like [[Team Fortress 2]] and Counter Strike: Source. As a result, many mods for Garry's Mod borrow assets from those games.

h4. See also
* [[Garry's mod (medium)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Garry's Mod":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garry%27s_Mod]
* "Official website":[https://gmod.facepunch.com]

title: foreman_spike
body:
A character from [i][[Wrecking Crew]][/i]. Described as a "mean old man" (意地悪おじさん) in the original Japanese manual and as a "Foreman" in the original English manual. He attempts to impede the progress of [[Mario]] or [[Luigi]] by destroying any walls, ladders, or pillars they are near, forcing them to fall. Functionally he performs the same role as Luigi's CPU did in [i]Vs. Wrecking Crew[/i].

While most of his appearances have very different looks from each other, his most consistent traits are that he wears [[sunglasses]] and has a [[beard]], though in [i]Wrecking Crew '98[/i] he is clean shaven with a visible [[cleft chin]]. In [i]Mobile Golf[/i] he was given a more [[fat_man|rotund]] body similar to that of [[Wario]]. 

Was originally known as [b]Blackey/Blacky[/b] (ブラッキー), until his appearance in [[the Super Mario Bros. Movie]] led to him adopting his international name [b]Spike[/b] (スパイク) in Japan.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25325031: Perfect Ban Mario Character Daijiten
* !asset #25325033: Wrecking Crew '98
* !asset #25325035: Mobile Golf
* !asset #25325083: The Super Mario Bros. Movie

h4. External link

* "Mario Wiki":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Foreman_Spike]
other_names: ブラッキー(マリオシリーズ)

title: anpanman
body:
[b]Anpanman[/b] (Anime title: Soreike! Anpanman! (それいけ!アンパンマン); Bread Man Anpanman!) is a children's manga and anime series created by Takashi Yanase. First published in 1982, it became one of the longest running TV shows in Japan. Despite its limited success abroad, it is the second most successful anime series of all time (after [[Doraemon]]) due to its wide range of merchandises.

The story involves [[Anpanman (character)|]], an anthromorpic [[anpan]] bread who lives with other various [[personification|anthromorphic]] breads, and their fight against his [[devil]] nemesis [[Baikinman]].

h5. Main characters

title: bastard!!
body:
[b]Bastard‼: Heavy Metal, Dark Fantasy[/b] (BASTARD!!-暗黒の破壊神- Basutādo!! Ankoku no Hakaishin?, lit. "Bastard!! The Destructive God of Darkness") is a manga by Kazushi Hagiwara. It first appeared in [[weekly_shounen_jump|Weekly Shōnen Jump]], in 1988, and continues to be published irregularly today in Ultra Jump. Currently, it spans 27 volumes.

There are two animated adaptations; a 6 episode OVA by AIC released in 1992, as well as a 39 episode series by Liden Films in 2022-2023.

A playable [i][[Genshin Impact]][/i] character. He was announced on February 4, 2022 and was Released on Version 2.6.

[[Kamisato Ayaka]]'s older brother and the current head of the Kamisato Clan. 

Voiced by [[Ishida Akira (voice actor)|]] in JP and Zhao Lu (赵路) on CN, both of which also voiced [[Otto Apocalypse]] from [i][[Honkai (Series)|Honkaiverse]] [/i]and [[Artem Wing (Tears of Themis)|]] in [i][[Tears of Themis]][/i].

His signature weapon is [[Haran Geppaku Futsu (Genshin Impact)|Haran Geppaku Futsu]]

* !post #5724608: [[Kamisato Ayato (Heytea)|Heytea collaboration]]

title: feebas
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0349 in the National Pokédex, a Water-type.

A brown, [[fish]]-like Pokémon covered in dark, irregular spots. Has large, deep-set eyes and [[pink lips]]. It is often considered, along with the similar [[Magikarp]] as the weakest Pokémon in the entire game due to being able to use only a single move, [[Splash (pokemon)|]], which deals no damage.

Evolves into [[Milotic]].

Japanese name: [b]Hinbass[/b]

h4. Official art
* !asset #25208627

h4. See also:
* [[Magikarp]]

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Feebas_(Pokémon)

Prior Pokémon: [[Armaldo]]
Next Pokémon: [[Milotic]]

title: magikarp
body:
[[Pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0129 in the National Pokédex, a Water-type.

A [[fish]] Pokémon with a red or orange body, wide eyes, and long yellow [[whiskers]], with its dorsal fin resembling a crown. It is often considered, along with the similar [[Feebas]] as the weakest Pokémon in the entire game due to being able to use only a single move, [[Splash (pokemon)|]], which deals no damage.

Evolves into [[Gyarados]].

Japanese name: [b]Koiking[/b]

title: g41_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K G41]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[cat ears]], [[heterochromia]] (right eye blue, left eye red), and wears white lingerie, long [[black gloves]] and [[thighhighs]]. There are however some differing opinions on whether her limbs and eye might be cybernetics or not.

According to her artist ([[ns (ntrsis)|]]), "I don't know if she's a cat, a dog or a fox..."

She is voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].
