title: tohsaka_rin
body:
Tohsaka Rin is a character from the [[fate (series)|Fate series]]. Master of [[Archer (fate)|]] in all three of [[Fate/stay night]]'s routes, she is the primary heroine of the Unlimited Blade Works route.

Rin has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in a [[two side up]] hairdo. She often wears a red [[sweater]] with a white cross on the front, a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]] and [[black thighhighs]]. 

She is a poster child for [[zettai ryouiki]] and the [[tsundere]] archetype.

title: pam-pam
body:
[[Delicious Party Precure]] character. A [[dog]] fairy who is [[Cure Spicy]]'s partner. She transforms into a "sandwich form" for Cure Spicy's transformation sequence. Later, she gains a [[pam-pam (human)|human form]].

[i]Pamu[/i] is probably a variation of [i]pan[/i], the Japanese word for [i]bread[/i].

title: five_nights_at_freddy's
body:
[b]Five Nights at Freddy's[/b], abbreviated as [b]FNAF[/b] , is a series of indie survival horror game series made by Scott Cawthon in which the player must protect themselves from hostile animatronics. The first game featured initially [[Freddy Fazbear]], [[Bonnie (fnaf)|]], [[Chica]] and [[Foxy (fnaf)|]], with further games including entirely new animatronics and variations of the existing ones.

h4. Games
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's 1]]
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's 2]]
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's 3]]
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's 4]]
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's: Sister Location]] (5)
* [[Freddy Fazbear's Pizzeria Simulator]] (6)
* [[Ultimate Custom Night]] (7)
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's: Help Wanted]] (8, VR)
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's: Security Breach]] (9)

h6. Spin-offs
* [[FNAF World]]
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's AR: Special Delivery]]
* Freddy in Space 2
* Five Nights at Freddy's: Into the Pit

h6. Fazbear Fanverse Initiative
* Five Nights at Candy’s
* [[Popgoes]]
* [[The Joy of Creation (fnaf)|]]
* One Night at Flumpty’s
* FNaF Plus
* Five Nights at Freddy's High School also FNAFHS

h4. See also
* [[List of Five Nights at Freddy's characters]]

h4. External Links
* "Scott Cawthon official site":http://scottgames.com/
* "Scott Cawthon youtube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2Xp5JeeO9sP6bhc-9yD1xA
* Namu Wiki: "Five Nights at Freddy's 시리즈":[https://namu.wiki/w/Five%20Nights%20at%20Freddy's%20%EC%8B%9C%EB%A6%AC%EC%A6%88]

title: medusa_(shingeki_no_bahamut)
body:
A character that appears in  [[Shingeki no Bahamut]], [[Granblue Fantasy]], [[Shadowverse]], and [[Princess Connect!]].

A mighty sorceress with an accursed petrifying gaze has landed, bearing the form of a sweet young girl. She comes with both great magical power and pride befitting a primal beast, but what will she impose on the people? Trials, destruction, or merely a bit of fun?

Although she'd be the last to admit it, this primal beast savors her time with her primal pals. However, an unexpected encounter with a young girl takes her down unexpected paths—is there room in this primal beast's heart to grow from a new experience?

h4.Official Alternate Costumes

* [[medusa_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)|Summer Medusa]]
* [[medusa_(valentine)_(granblue_fantasy)|Valentines Medusa]]

title: kaiboukan_no._30_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Number 30[/i]. Nicknamed Mito (みと). Character designed by [[Hozuka (kadokawa)|]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[grey hair]] tied into [[double_bun|small buns]] tied to ribbons with small anchors in the ends and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sisters: a [[white headwear|white]] [[sailor hat]], a [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[blue_sailor_collar|blue]] [[sailor collar]], blue accents, [[yellow bow]] with a pair of [[uwabaki]], and [[black pantyhose]]. 

Her [[rigging]] basically consists of a miniature version of her namesake ship slung to her left like a bag, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, and several [[depth charge]]s, one around each thigh and several in a cage container wrapped in green cloth.

The historical [i]Number 30[/i] had an uneventful history with her only highlight being her survival from torpedo attacks twice. She was sunk by Royal Navy aircraft at Yura on July 28, 1945 and eventually salvaged and scrapped in 1948.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4742802: Base form
* !asset #24845365: Halloween
* !post #4970606: [[Kaiboukan no. 30 (christmas) (kancolle)|Christmas]]
* !post #5999518: Setsubun
* !post #7279662: [[Kaiboukan no. 30 (hinamatsuri) (kancolle)|Hinamatsuri]]

title: sabrina_(girls'_frontline_2)
body:
An android imprinted with [[SPAS-12]] [[shotgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], [[spas-12 (girls' frontline)|returning]] from the [[Girls' Frontline|first game]]. Voiced by Kobori Miyuki.

title: imi_negev_ng-7
body:
The Negev NG-7 is an [[Israel]]i 7.62×51mm NATO gas-operated [b][[machine gun]][/b], introduced in 2012. The design is based on the earlier [[IMI Negev|Negev NG-5]] [[light machine gun|LMG]]. 

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "IWI Negev":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IWI_Negev]

title: kafra_uniform
body:
In [[Ragnarok Online]], the Kafra Corporation (or simply Kafra) is a company that provides players with certain services. The Kafra uniform mainly consists of a [[maid headdress]], a [[brown dress|brown]] [[maid|maid dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[white apron]], a [[red sash]], [[white gloves]], and [[holding clipboard|holding]] a clipboard and [[holding pen|pen]]. Sampaguita wears a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[orange shirt|orange]] [[crop top]] with an [[orange skirt|orange]] [[miniskirt]] instead.

All of the known employees have had their names translated several times.

* [[Pavianne (ragnarok online)|]] / Deporte / Defolty (ディフォルテー)
* [[Blossom (ragnarok online)|]] / Tailring / Telling (テーリング)
* [[Jasmine (ragnarok online)|]] / Sorin (ソリン )
* [[Roxie (ragnarok online)|]] / Vinit / Bennit (ビニット)
* [[Leilah  (ragnarok online)|]] / Glarice / Glaris (グラリス)
* [[Curly Sue]] / Debril / W (ダブリュー)
* [[Sampaguita (ragnarok online)|]] / Comodo Kafra (コモドのカプラ)
* [[Alty (ragnarok online)|]] / Lovelean (アルティ)
* [[Lyrus (ragnarok online)|]] / Lyrith / Schwarzwald Kafra (ライラス)
* [[Caprese (ragnarok online)|]] (カプレーゼ )

h4. See also

title: inomata_mutsumi
body: Female Illustrator most known for her anime character design work in the early to mid 1980s. That her designs defined the first half of that decade would be an understatement. She provided the character designs for [i]Leda: Fantastic Adventure of Yohko[/i] and [i]Windaria[/i]; and  for "Tales of" video game series. Worked with "Team Destiny" in the Namco Tales Studio. Inomata was also a prolific novel illustrator, known for her vivid watercolor paintings which often center around young women with wide, jewel-like eyes. "Passed away":[https://twitter.com/inomatanekomata/status/1769574473504883081] on March 10, 2024. Her family never disclosed the cause of her death.

title: iggy_(jojo)
body:
A supporting character from Part 3 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].  His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[The Fool (stand)|]].

A [[Boston Terrier]] possessing human-like intelligence and a fondness for coffee-flavored chewing gum.
other_names: イギー(ジョジョの奇妙な冒険)

title: the_fool_(tarot)
body:
One of the cards in a [[tarot]] deck. The Fool may be numbered 0 or ∞ (infinity).

h4. Appearance

Depending on the deck, the Fool may be depicted as a beggar in ragged clothes or a young man walking towards the edge of a [[cliff|precipice]]. The Fool is often seen wearing a [[jester cap]] and/or carrying a [[bindle]], and they may be accompanied by a dog.

* !asset #24747535: [[Rider-Waite tarot|Rider-Waite]]

h4.See also

* [[joker (playing card)|]]
* [[tarot]]
* [[The fool (stand)|]] ([[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] [[Stardust Crusaders]])
* [[Priscilla Twilight]] ([[Gen'ei wo Kakeru Taiyou]])
* [[yuuki makoto (persona 3)|Hero]] ([[Persona 3]])
* [[Narukami yu|Hero]] ([[Persona 4]])
* [[Amamiya Ren|Hero]] ([[Persona 5]])
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: stardust_crusaders
body:
Part 3 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].

Originally serialized in Weekly Shounen Jump from 1989 to 1992 for 152 chapters and collected into sixteen volumes, it was later adapted into an OVA series, between 1993 and 2002, and the 48-episode second season of the TV anime, which aired from 2014 to 2015.

This story arc marked the first appearance of [[stand (jojo)|stands]], which would become a staple in the JoJo universe.

h4. Characters | Stands

h6. Protagonists

* [[Kujo Jotaro]] | [[Star Platinum]]
* [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] | [[Hermit Purple]]
* [[Mohammed Avdol]] | [[Magician's Red]]
* [[Kakyoin Noriaki]] | [[Hierophant Green]]
* [[Jean Pierre Polnareff]] | [[Silver Chariot]]
* [[Iggy (jojo)|]] | [[The Fool (stand)|]]
other_names: スターダストクルセイダース

title: the_fool_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Iggy (jojo)|]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. It bestows the power to manipulate sand to great effect.

Being made of sand, its form can vary widely. Its main form is somewhat like a car chassis, with the front wheels replaced by a pair of muscled arms, and a mask with feather-like objects sticking from its head.

Name is taken directly from [i]The Fool[/i] [[Tarot]] card of the Major Arcana.

title: rozaliya_olenyeva
body:
A character from [i][[Honkai (series)|Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i]. She is the twin sister of [[Liliya Olenyeva]], the Vodka Girls.

She is an adoptive daughter of Cocolia. Rozaliya grew up in the same orphanage along with [[Bronya Zaychik]], her sister, and [[Seele Vollerei]].

When appearing in a post together with [[Delta (honkai Impact)|Delta]] (e.g. post #4816335), tag as [[time paradox]].

title: tsum-tsum
body: A Japanese franchise featuring collectible plush toys and mobile games based on [[Disney]] characters. The name "Tsum Tsum" comes from the Japanese verb "tsumu," meaning "to stack," reflecting the toys' design for stacking.

title: windows_classic
body:
The "classic" versions of [[Microsoft Windows]], including [[windows 95|95]], [[windows 98|98]], [[windows 2000|2000]], and [[windows me|ME]]. Characterized by, among other things, the aesthetic of their UI, featuring boxy buttons and windows, pixelated icons, and the (by default) gray and blue color scheme.

h4. See also
* [[Microsoft Windows]]

title: rody_soul
body:
Rody Soul is a minor character from [[Boku No Hero Academia]].

h4. Appearance

Rody is a young man with spiky [[brown hair]] tied into a [[high ponytail|high]] [[split ponytail]], along with [[grey eyes]] and sun-kissed skin.

He wears a [[red bandana]] along with a pair of [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on head|on his head]], as well as a pale [[blue shirt|blue button-up shirt]] with a number of [[patches|]] and a [[beige jacket|tan-beige jacket]] with an [[orange flower]] sticking out from the left chest pocket. He wears a pair of thick, [[grey gloves]] and a blue and red [[striped necktie|striped tie]]. He also wears a pair of [[black pants]] that stop just above his ankles with patches on the knees, as well as a pair of dark [[brown footwear|brown shoes]] with a gray cloth wrapped around each of them.

body:
An alternate costume of [[Saber Alter]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The qualifier is a shortened form of the full name, [b]Jet Black King of Knights ver. Shinjuku 1999[/b].

The costume consists of [[shorts]], [[thigh boots]], [[black jacket]], black [[sleeveless shirt]], [[necklace]], and her hair tied on a [[low ponytail]] with a [[black ribbon]].

title: toriel
body:
A motherly goat monster in [[Undertale]]. Fond of snails, pies, and puns. Affectionately nicknamed "Goat Mom/Goatmom" by fans.

An alternate version of her appears in [[Deltarune]].

title: rotom
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0479 in the National Pokédex.

A plasma-based creature with a whitish-blue [[aura]] of [[electricity]] that forms lightning bolt-shaped appendages. It has [[teeth]], and its [[blue eyes]] have a dividing line across them.

It has the ability to change its form and type by possessing an [[electric fan]], [[refrigerator]], [[microwave]], [[lawnmower]], or [[washing machine]]. 

Additionally, it can possess a [[pokedex|Pokédex]], [[smartphone]], [[computer]], [[drone]], or [[bicycle]]; these forms aid the Trainer but are not usable in battle.

See [[Rotom (other)]] for fan works where Rotom is seen possessing other appliances.

Japanese name: [b]Rotom[/b]

h4. Appearance

title: kannawa_azusa
body:
The main character of [[Bukiyou na Senpai]]. She has feelings for her junior, [[Kamegawa Yuu]], but has a hard time expressing herself. She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]].

She works at the same company as [[Kanzaki Sayaka (HG ni koisuru futari)|]] from [[HG ni Koisuru Futari]], and is her junior.

title: hype_beast_crypto
body:
A [[official alternate costume|legendary skin]] for [[Crypto (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], inspired by [[streetwear]] and Korean [[hip hop]] [[fashion]]. The skin is permanently available and can be crafted for 1200 crafting materials. Infamous among fans, as it's bold and overt style clashes with Crypto's careful and secretive characterization.

In this appearance, Crypto has [[undercut]] [[blonde hair]] worn in tied [[cornrows]], a [[bandaid on stomach|bandaid on his stomach]], and wears  [[grey pants]], [[purple footwear|purple]] [[sneakers]], [[sunglasses]], a [[gold chain]] and an [[open jacket|open]] [[multicolored jacket]] exposing his [[bare pectorals]].

For Season 12's anniversary event, [[Mirage (apex legends)|]] and [[Wattson (apex legends)|]] recieved new legendary skins based on Hype Beast ([[Lit Witt Mirage|Lit Witt]] and [[Thunder Kitty Wattson|Thunder Kitty]] respectively). This in turn prompted a trend of artists drawing their own interpretations of Hype Beast-inspired skins for the rest of the legends.

title: minneapolis_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the heavy cruiser USS [i]Minneapolis[/i] (CA-36). Character designed by [[Hoshiakari (C2 Kikan)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[twintails]], and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]New Orleans[/i]-class uniform: a [[blue shirt]], [[black choker]], [[white ribbon|white]] [[neck ribbon]], [[grey gloves]], [[grey apron]], [[blue skirt]], [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[grey hat|grey]] [[mini hat]] patterned off her real-life bridge. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces, each with a 203 mm triple gun mount, 127 mm single pedestal mount, and [[aircraft catapult]]s; held to her back by her two funnels. In her Kai form, Minneapolis' apron gets shortened in the front, she adds an SK [[radar]] antenna on her right arm, and her rigging gains a pair of [[Oerlikon 20mm gun]] mounts. 

The damaged art of Minneapolis' base form has the detail of several [[log]]s piled up in her destroyed bow, mirroring actual damage-control measures taken by Minneapolis' crew in 1942. This is the major detail connecting Minneapolis to her Abyssal form, [[New Heavy Cruiser Princess]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9039313: Base
* !post #9039081: Kai

h4. [i]New Orleans[/i]-class heavy cruisers

* [[Tuscaloosa (Kancolle)|]] (CA-37)

* [[Minneapolis (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Minneapolis[/i] (CA-36)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Minneapolis_(CA-36)]

title: hu_tao_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Pyro character in [[Genshin Impact]]. She is the 77th Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor, a person vital to managing Liyue's funerary affairs.

She has [[red eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], and she wears brown clothing. She has a [[ghost]] companion called [[Boo Tao (genshin impact)|]].

Many of her attacks scale based on how low her HP is. As a result, comic fanart tends to depict her as [[masochism|masochistic]], or at the very least disliking healers.

In Chinese and Japanese, the two kanji that spell Hu Tao's name have the meaning of "walnut", but Hu is her family name while Tao is her given name. She is the only Liyue character with her family name displayed on the in-game character menu. Japanese fans sometimes accidentally (or deliberately) misspell her name as [i]Kurumi[/i], the Japanese word for "walnut"; however, her name is pronounced Hu Tao even in the Japanese version of the game.

She is the official leader of the Earth Federation.

Mitsuba has [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] tied into [[low twintails]], and [[green eyes]], wearing a [[white hairband]] on her head and a [[triangle earrings|triangle earring]] on her left ear, she wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[military uniform]] with a [[red necktie|red]] [[short necktie]] and a [[white capelet]] over her shoulders, and [[black pantyhose]] and [[white footwear|grayish footwear]].

title: biopunk
body:
A genre of [[science fiction]]/[[horror (theme)|]] and is the literary sister genre of [[cyberpunk]], focusing on the use of biological technology and its effects on society. Usually very "meaty" in style with grotesque imagery, raw sexual motif, [[guro]], [[living clothes]], [[tentacles]], [[exposed muscle]] and [[body horror]] being common visual staples. With the intention to fascinate the viewer with the exotic yet familiar imagery and make them feels uncomfortable at the same time.

In terms of aesthetics, pure biopunk art can typically be divided into two main styles: Style A which typically merge machinery and organics (think a computer with an organic brain) or style B which has the organics take over the role of machinery (think that the whole computer is made of organic matter).

h4. Notable Biopunk franchises

* [[Alien (1979)|]]
* [[Angel at Dusk]]
* [[Baoh Raihousha]]
* [[Contra]]
* [[Genocyber]]
* [[Jurassic Park]]
* [[Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver]]
* [[Metroid]]
* [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]
* [[Resident Evil]]
* [[Scorn (game)|]]
* Tekkaman Blade Twin Blood
* [[Yakouga]]

h4. See also

* [[Steampunk]]
* [[Cyberpunk]]
* [[Dieselpunk]]

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia: Biopunk":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biopunk

title: tokoyami_towa
body: A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s 4th generation, also called "[[holoForce]]". Designed by [[Rurudo]]. Towa is a [[demon girl]] with [[green eyes]], [[pointy ears]], a [[demon tail]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[colored inner hair]] (with later costumes and revisions to her base model adding a pink [[gradient hair|gradient]] too), kept in [[twintails]] with [[double-parted bangs]] forming a [[center-flap bangs|flap]] [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]] and [[sidelocks]] with [[hairclip]]s. She has multiple [[spike piercing|spike]] and hoop [[ear piercing]]s on both ears with also an [[earclip]] on her right ear and an [[industrial piercing]] on her left ear, she also has a [[navel piercing]] and even some [[tail piercing|piercings on her tail]]. She wears a [[black hat|black]] [[horned headwear|horned]] [[baseball cap]] with an OwO face, which is actually her pet and mascot [[Bibi (tokoyami towa)|]]. h4. Costumes h5. title: classic_sonic
body: The retro, silent version of [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] originating from the franchise’s early days. He's characterized by his shorter, rounder appearance with black eyes, as opposed to the taller "Modern Sonic" with green eyes that debuted in later 3D games. While Sonic’s classic look first appeared in the original 1991 game, it was in [i][[Sonic Generations]][/i] that this version was firmly reintroduced into the main timeline as a distinct, canonical character.

It consists of an [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[short kimono|short]] [[black kimono]] with  [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]]  and a [[pelvic curtain]], multiple [[thigh strap]]s, [[bandaged leg|bandages on her left leg]], [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[okobo]]. She also wears a [[single earring|single]] black [[tassel earrings|tassel earring]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume.
* [[Short hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[sidelocks]]
* [[Long hair]] done in a [[two side up]].
Both hairstyles have [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[center-flap bangs]] that are decorated with a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] and [[hair flower]]s

title: vestia_zeta_(jirai_kei)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Vestia Zeta]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/hololive_Id/status/1691465616337883139], it has a [[jirai kei]] theme.

It consists of a [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[frilled sleeves]] and [[frilled shirt collar|collar]], a [[black choker|black]] [[studded choker]] with a [[pendant choker|pendant]] of traditional indonesian shadow puppets called [i]wayang[/i], a [[blue bowtie]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a pair of black [[suspenders]] holding a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with a wayang [[print skirt|print]] a [[cat o-ring]] [[o-ring thigh strap|thigh_strap]] [[black socks|black]] [[loose socks]] and [[grey slippers|grey]] [[cat slippers]]. She also has a [[handgun]], a [[blue bag|blue]] [[handbag]] and [[cat ear headphones]] as optional accessories.

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[short hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with a [[side_braid|side]] [[ribbon braid]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15444932: Profile

title: hezi
body:
Hezi is a [[hanfu]] top that can be worn as outerwear or as an undergarment. Hezi is strapless, similar to a [[bandeau]] or a [[tube top]].

Hezi can be worn with various styles, mostly commonly [[qixiong ruqun]]. 

[[Heziqun]] is [b]always[/b] worn with a hezi, but not all clothes with a hezi is a heziqun.

title: yumeno_kyuusaku_(bungou_stray_dogs)
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life author/journalist Yasumichi Sugiyama/Kyuusaku Yumeno (1889-1936). 

They are portrayed as an [[androgynous]] with [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-color]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]], and [[black eyes]]. Their outfit consists of a [[blue hat|blue]] [[mini hat]], [[double-breasted]] [[blue jacket]], [[yellow scarf]], red [[shoulder bag]], [[brown shorts]], [[white socks|white kneehighs]], and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #6221883

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Kyuusaku Yumeno":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yumeno_Ky%C5%ABsaku]
other_names: 夢野久作(文豪ストレイドッグス)

title: glutton
body:
An excessively greedy [[eating|eater]], over-indulgent, and someone who consumes vast quantities of [[food]].

This can be indicated in several ways, such as the image featuring an [[oversized food]], the character became [[fat]] or [[obese]] after indulging on such a meal, or several [[empty plate]]s and [[bowl]]s being strewn around them.

title: ozaki_kouyou_(bungou_stray_dogs)
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, a [[genderswap]] of the real-life poet Tokutarou Ozaki (1868-1903, better known by his pen name Kouyou). She is part of [[Mori Ougai (bungou stray dogs)|]]'s Port Mafia faction. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] tied to a single [[hair bun]] to the back, and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit is [[Japanese clothes|traditional-themed]] and comprises a [[black kimono]] with [[floral print]], [[pink coat|pink]] [[haori]] (also with floral print), [[black hakama]], and [[brown boots]]. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ozaki Kouyou":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ozaki_K%C5%8Dy%C5%8D]
other_names: 尾崎紅葉(文豪ストレイドッグス)

body:

When an artist imitates the style of a particular era, but not a specific artist, use [[retro artstyle]] or a specific decade style tag (e.g. [[1990s (style)]]) instead. When an artist imitates the style of [[official art]], use [[official style]] instead.

title: obi_hajime
body:
[i][[Gintama]][/i] character. The focus of one of the later arcs.

Brother figure to [[Shimura Tae]] and [[Shimura Shinpachi]]. Turned into a cyborg.

Heavily based off of Ewan McGregor's [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] from the [i][[Star Wars]][/i] prequels.

title: hirotsu_ryuurou_(bungou_stray_dogs)
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life novelist Naoto Hirotsu/Ryuurou Hirotsu (1861-1928). 

He is portrayed with an [[old]] appearance from his later years, having [[grey hair]], [[glasses]], and a [[mustache]] and [[beard]]. His outfit consists of a [[white shirt]], [[black pants]], [[black coat]], [[brown scarf]], and [[black boots]]. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ryuurou Hirotsu":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirotsu_Ryur%C5%8D]
other_names: 広津柳浪(文豪ストレイドッグス)

title: natsume_souseki_(bungou_stray_dogs)
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life novelist Kinnousuke Natsume/Souseki Natsume (1867-1916). 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] that [[hair over one eye|covers]] his right eye, [[brown eyes]], and a [[mustache]]. As a callback to his novel [i]I Am A Cat[/i], he is also portrayed as a [[cat]] with brown fur. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Souseki Natsume":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natsume_S%C5%8Dseki]
other_names: 夏目漱石(文豪ストレイドッグス)

title: koda_aya_(bungou_stray_dogs)
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life novelist/essayist Aya Kouda (1904-1990). 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]; her outfit consists of a [[yellow dress]] worn under a [[brown coat]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[pink shoes]].

title: oichi_(sengoku_basara)
body:
Oichi is a character from the [[Sengoku Basara]] series. Known as [b]Demon Queen of the Fifth Heaven[/b], and the younger sister of [[oda_nobunaga_(sengoku_basara)|Oda Nobunaga]]. She is also the wife of [[azai_nagamasa_(sengoku_basara)|Azai Nagamasa]]. She is an unpretentious and unassertive, speaks in the third person, and usually assumes everything is her imperfection.

She becomes a playable character in [b]Sengoku Basara 2 Heroes[/b], and reappears in [[Sengoku Basara 3]] in the aftermath of [spoiler]Nagamasa's death.[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[noto_mamiko|Noto Mamiko]].

body:

Based on the historical figure "Uesugi Kenshin":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uesugi_Kenshin.

For other uses, see the [[Uesugi Kenshin (ambiguous)|ambiguous page]].

title: azai_nagamasa_(sengoku_basara)
body:
A character in the game and anime series [[Sengoku Basara]]. He wears white and red armor, and is armed with a [[katana]] and a buckler-like [[shield]] on his left arm.

He is the husband of [[Oichi (Sengoku Basara)|]].

title: isekai_meikyuu_de_harem_wo
body:
A 2012-to-present web novel series written by Sogano Shachi with illustrations by [[Shikidouji]] in the light novel version. There is also a 2017 manga adaption with art by [[Hyouju Issei]] and an anime adaption by [i]Passione[/i] that aired in Summer 2022.
In the adaptions following the original web novel, the word [i]dorei[/i] ("slave") was removed from the copyright's title, possibly of its negative and/or sexual associations.

title: seven_prisoners_(blue_archive)
body:
The Seven Prisoners (七囚人, Seven Prisoners) are a group of problem students in Kivotos.

Seven Prisoners is an umbrella term used to refer to the seven students that broke out of the Correction Bureau after the General Student Council President's disappearance. Because only problem students are sent to the Correction Bureau, all seven students belonging to the Seven Prisoners are extremely dangerous, in one way or another. It is later revealed that [[Professor Niyaniya (blue_archive)|]] was responsible for releasing the Seven Prisoners. The tag should only be used if three or more of the Seven Prisoners appear together.

Currently known members:
* [[Akemi (blue_archive)|]]
* [[Akira (blue_archive)|]]
* [[Kai_(blue_archive)|]]
* [[Wakamo (blue_archive)|]]

https://bluearchive.fandom.com/wiki/Seven_Prisoners

title: roxanne_(isekai_meikyuu_de_harem_wo)
body:
Character in [[Isekai Meikyuu de Harem wo]]. Roxanne is the first party member and slave of [[Kaga Michio]].

Roxanne is described as stunningly beautiful, with enchanting reddish [[brown eyes]], magnificent [[lips]], thick chestnut [[brown hair]], and [[large breasts]]. Her height is similar to Michio's, a little over 160 cm. She is a [[dog girl]] who has soft [[floppy ears|floppy]] [[dog ears]] and a [[dog tail]].
Roxanne usually wears a [[black hairband]], [[black collar|black]] [[o-ring collar]], [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[green shirt]], [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]], [[green pants]], [[black belt]], and [[sandals]]. She also wears a [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt]].

She is voiced by [[Mikami Shiori]].

h4. See Also

* "Harem in the Labyrinth of the Other World Wiki: Roxanne":https://slave-harem.fandom.com/wiki/Roxanne

title: project_wingman
body:
A flight combat arcade-style game in the vein of [[ace_combat|Ace Combat]] developed by Sector D2 Games. Set in a post-apocalyptic world following a massive tectonic event, the game's story focuses on a mercenary pilot named [[Monarch (Project Wingman)|]] and the company he works for, Sicario. He and his fellow mercenaries are hired by the Republic of Cascadia as they attempt to break away from the hegemonic Pacific Federation. Of note is the presence of a voiced WSO, [[Prez (Project Wingman)|]], should the player fly a two-seater aircraft. 

The game was originally released on December 1st 2020 for PC and was later ported on [[Xbox One]] and [[Playstation 5]] on October 28th 2021 and October 3rd 2023 respectively. A DLC mini campaign, titled [b]Project Wingman: Frontline 59[/b] was originally released exclusively on the PS5 version of the game before being available on other ports. In Frontline 59, the campaign focused on Division K-9, a squad of Federation reserve pilots who are called into action as the Federation suffers loses from their war with Cascadia. The player takes the role of [[Driver (project wingman)|]], as he and K-9 Squad help the retreating Federation forces while fighting off a counter-invasion by Cascadia forces led by General [[Faust (project wingman)|]]. Like Monarch, Driver also has WSO, [[Eye-Tee (project wingman)|]], should the player fly a two-seater aircraft.
other_names: プロジェクト・ウィングマン

title: glowing_eyes
body:
For eyes that shine. This could be a usual visual trait of the character or it could indicate the character is using some sort of special power. It can also be used humorously to indicate that the character is about to respond aggressively to an opportunity or provocation, often involving an unsuspecting victim.

If only a single eye is glowing, use [[glowing eye]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[Glowing eye]]
* [[Eye trail]]
* "Know Your Meme":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/glowing-eyes-laser-eyes

title: smoking
body:
The act of lighting up a substance like tobacco and either inhaling or tasting the [[smoke]] it emits. This can be done with [[cigarette|cigarettes]], [[cigar|cigars]], [[smoking pipe|pipes]], [[hookah]], [[bong]] and [[kiseru]]. Illegal recreational drugs like [[marijuana]], cocaine and methamphetamine can be smoked as well.

This tag can apply both when the actual inhaling/exhaling of smoke is shown and when the smoker is merely holding the implement they are currently using (such as a lit cigarette).

title: narmaya_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Playable dark-type character in [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i].

A  [[katana]]-wielding [[draph]] girl with [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[purple hair]] adorned with hair ornaments that's fashioned with two [[low tied hair|low-tied]] frontal locks, a [[single braid|single left-sided braid]], and [[hair over one eye|bangs draped over her left eye]]. Has horns are black and curve towards the front. Like most draph characters, she also has [[large breasts]].

Wears a [[sleeveless]] coat that is closed at the top. Underneath is a black vest-like garment with various belts with what seems to be [[bottomless|no bottom]]. Her legwear consists of a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black]] thighhigh on her left leg and a [[black footwear|black boot]] on her right along with a [[thigh strap]] (both footwear having [[high heels]]). Lastly, she has [[black gloves|black]] [[uneven gloves|uneven]] [[elbow gloves]].

Narmaya has a overall airy and aloof demeanor. She is rather obsessive over the [[gran (granblue fantasy)|main]] [[djeeta (granblue fantasy)|character]], constantly babying and worrying about him/her whilst wanting to be seen as a big sister.

Due to her popularity, she has been given a number of alternate versions: an SSR Water Summer version in 2016, an SSR Earth Holiday version in 2019 and a Grand version in 2021.

title: yabuki_joe_in_a_chair_(meme)
body:
[[Parody]] of a scene from [[Ashita no Joe]], featuring the titular character [[Yabuki Joe]] [[sitting]] on a [[chair]] in a [[boxing ring]] corner with [[closed eyes]] and a [[light smile]] on his face, complete with a [[spotlight]] effect shining on him. Sometimes, a [[monochrome]] effect is applied to the character to replicate the scene.

[spoiler]The scene is, in fact, the finale scene of the manga and anime. After 15 rounds of a World Bantamweight Championship bout between Yabuki Joe and the champion José Mendoza, where both fighters dealt severe concussion damage against each other, Joe silently sat on the corner as the beaten and scarred Mendoza is declared the winner, and is unresponsive when [[Tange Danpei]] went to told him the result.

Takamori Asao, the writer of the series, later confirmed that Joe has died due to severe concussion suffered throughout his boxing career, though the manga illustrator Chiba Tetsuya chose not to comment on Joe's fate, hinting that he might have survived. In the 1980 anime adaptation, the added scene concluded that Joe has indeed died.[/spoiler]

The scene is known in Japan by the quote that Joe said to his coach [[Tange Danpei]] as he sat down; [i]"I'm burnt out... into the ash..."[/i] ("燃え尽きたぜ...真っ白にな..." [i]moetsukita ze... masshiro ni na...[/i]. Lit. [i]"I'm burnt out... and turned white..."[/i]). The meme is used to represent that the character is completely tired from doing something, and/or has no regrets in doing so.

h4. See also

* [[Shinji in a chair (meme)]]
other_names: 燃え尽きたぜ...真っ白にな...

title: laffey_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of the [i]Benson[/i]-class destroyer USS [i]Laffey[/i] (DD-459). 
Character design by [[Kaede (Yumesaki Kaede)|]], voiced by [[Naganawa Maria]].

She is a petite girl with [[red eyes]] and [[white hair]] tied in fluffy [[twintails]], and posesses a [[hairband]] with [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[rabbit ears]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white camisole]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], or [[thigh boots]], depending on the artist, with [[rudder footwear|rudders attached]], and a [[pink jacket]].

She is often portrayed as [[sleepy]] or tired, or even as [[drunk]] (with her preferred drink being whiskey). This is a reference to the historical [i]Laffey[/i]'s final battle against the Japanese battleship [[Hiei (azur lane)|]] and two other destroyers during the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal, where Laffey nearly collided with Hiei due to the battle taking place at midnight. She would eventually sink after taking direct hits from Hiei's 356 mm guns and a torpedo from destroyer [[Murasame (kancolle)|]].

Her name was later reused for the more famous [i]Allen M. Sumner[/i]-class destroyer, [[Laffey II (Azur Lane)|]].

title: yuuki_haru
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. 

Haru is a former rival idol who enjoys soccer. She has a harsh, no holds barred personality. Considered to be a [[tomboy]] and delinquent, Haru uses the pronoun "ore", which is barely used by females. She doesn’t like cute clothes and shows extreme displeasure when forced into a bunny costume for an event. 

She is voiced by [[Koichi Makoto]].

title: external_fuel_tank
body: An extra fuel tank mounted externally to the body of an [[aircraft]]. Usually (but not always) mounted below the centerline of said aircraft for balance purposes, and sometimes mounted in a way that the external tank can be dropped to allow the aircraft better maneuverability.

In this costume, she wears a [[white jacket|white]] [[hooded jacket]] with a [[bear hood]] worn over either a [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress]] and [[black leg warmers]]. She also has a [[white dress]] variant.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

Both of them have [[braided bangs|braided]] [[fanged bangs]] with [[center-flap bangs|center flap]] and are decorated with a [[white hairband|white]] [[bow hairband]].

Ferrari's main rivals include [[Lamborghini]] and [[Porsche]].

title: watson_amelia
body:
A former [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], and member of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s 1st generation, [[holoMyth]]. Designed by [[Nabi (UZ02)|]].

A [[detective]] time traveler with a [[Sherlock Holmes]] motif. Refers to herself as "Amelia Watson" to make her name sound more natural for English-speaking viewers. Also known as "Ame" for short.

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], hiding [[large breasts|a sizable bust]] under the layers of clothing. Her default hairstyle is a [[bob cut]] with a monocle [[hair ornament]].

Despite being called "the most normal-looking" and "oddball" out of the other [[HoloMyth]] debut (due to her not being a monster girl), she is actually the most chaotic of the bunch. She also likes to make jokes and banter, giving rise to her connection with the [[ground pound]] meme.

Her mascot and pet dog [[Bubba (watson amelia)|]] can occasionally be heard during her streams. She also has a pet cat named [[Wellington (watson amelia)|]].

Due to their frequent collaborations and chemistry both in videos and on Twitter, it is common to see her coupled with [[Gawr Gura]], a ship known as "AmeSame". Fans were quick to also compare her to [[Akai Haato]] due to their similar chaotic nature, which extends to collabs.

She reached one million subscribers on February 11 (JST) / 10 (PST) 2021.

Her general activities ended on September 30th, 2024, but she did not fully "graduate" and is still affiliated with Cover Corp, participating in future projects.

title: united_states_capitol
body: Also known as the Capitol Building, the United States Capitol is the seat of the American governmental legislature called the United States Congress. It is located at the eastern end of the National Mall in [[Washington D.C.]], the [[United States]].

title: new_orleans
body: The city of New Orleans (French: Nouvelle-Órleans; Creole: Nouvèl Orleans) is a city in the state of [[Louisiana]], the [[United States]]. The city was first established in 1718 and is known for its rich culture. New Orleans is the largest city in Louisiana by population.

title: mercedes-benz_300sl
body: The Mercedes-Benz 300 SL (chassis code W198) is a two-seat [[sports car]] produced by [[Mercedes-Benz]] as a [[gullwing doors|gullwinged]] coupe (1954–1957) and roadster (1957–1963). It was based on the company's 1952 racer, the W194, with mechanical direct fuel injection which boosted power almost 50 percent in its 3.0L overhead camshaft straight-six engine. Capable of top speeds of up to 263 km/h (163 mph), it was a sports car racing champion and the fastest production car of its time.

title: kawasaki_(company)
body:
A Japanese company specializing in heavy machinery and [[motorcycle]]s.

Its origin can be traced back to the early 20th century, when the company was one of the major [i]zaibatsu[/i] in Japan. Along with its rival [[Mitsubishi]], Kawasaki produced a wide variety of civilian and [[military]] products.

Its name comes from the surname of the founder. For a city with the same name, see [[Kawasaki (Kanagawa)]].

title: selena:_capriccio_(pgr)
body:
The Omniframe of [[Selena (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
A frame of Selena, more human-like in appearance compared to her [[selena: tempest (pgr)|Tempest]] frame, the only mechanical element on Capriccio is the [[single mechanical arm]] as her left arm, attached just above the elbow. On her Capriccio frame Selena also has [[purple eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[black hair]], [[colored inner hair|inner hair]] has [[blue hair|blue colour]], other taggable hairstyle elements are [[half updo]] tied by a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]] and her hair [[parted hair|parts]] into two at the lower back.

Clothing element consist of a [[black shrug|black short sleeved shrug]], [[bodystocking]] covering her back, oblique and armpit areas, and a [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress|white]] [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[short dress]] with a [[side slit]] to the left. She wears a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[toeless legwear|toeless]] [[boots]]. In her final awakening level her dress becomes a [[black dress]], her bare legs are covered by [[black pantyhose]], and all of the upper bodystocking removed.

She uses a weaponised [[flute]] in combat, a blade is hidden within the opening end, when depicted it can look like a [[sword]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[selena: capriccio (irisfall ballad) (pgr)|Irisfall Ballad]]

Since the H2R is a track-only bike, a detuned road-legal [b]Ninja H2[/b] model is available.

title: panty_&_stocking_with_garterbelt
body:
An action-comedy anime series produced by [[Gainax]], airing from October 2, 2010 to December 25, 2010. Notable for its western art style.

It's the story about two [[angel]]s thrown out of [[heaven]] who now occupy a city located somewhere between heaven and [[hell]] where strange monsters called "[[Ghost_(psg)|]]s" start terrorizing the place. By destroying these Ghosts they receive Heaven Coins which will allow them back into heaven.

An upcoming second season will air in July 2025 that will be produced by [[Trigger (company)|]].

body: Series of touring [[motorcycle]]s made by [[Honda]]. The first three generations used a flat-four engine instead of the 1800cc flat-six for which the Gold Wing is known.

title: honda_vfr
body: Series of sports touring [[motorcycle]]s with V4 engines made by [[Honda]].

title: honda_hsv-010_gt
body: A [[Super GT]] GT500 [[racecar]] fielded by [[Honda]] from 2010 through 2013, unique among GT500 cars for not having a road-going counterpart. Its high-revving V8 engine was originally developed for [[Super Formula Championship|Formula Nippon]].

title: honda_spirior
body:
The Honda Spirior is a sedan made by [[Honda]] and sold in China.

Initially a rebadge of the JDM eighth-generation [[Honda Accord]] (or North American [[Acura]] TSX), the second generation got its own chassis from 2015 through 2018.

title: honda_cr-z
body: The Honda CR-Z is a hybrid hatchback made by [[Honda]]. It is often viewed as a spiritual successor to the [[Honda CR-X]].

title: honda_accord
body: The Honda Accord is a series of midsize [[car]]s manufactured by [[Honda]] since 1976. It is a size class larger than the [[Honda Civic|Civic]].
